brandHighlight.data: Our timeless American story dates back three generations to when the Trinchero family left their home in New York City to pursue the American Dream in Napa Valley. The family purchased Sutter Home Winery in 1948, after the winery had been closed for almost 30 years due to Prohibition. Still family-owned and now celebrating our 75th anniversary this year, Sutter Home has a long history of delivering wine that people love, starting with the creation of the original White Zinfandel in the 1970s. Sutter Home is proud to be the brand generations of wine lovers trust to deliver consistent, award-winning quality and value for every wine occasion. We were honored to be awarded the Distinguished Service Award for “having introduced more Americans to wine on the table than anyone in history” from Wine Spectator. We will forever stand by our promise to create “a great product for a fair price.”

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Sutter Home Sauvignon Blanc White Wine is a brisk, lively wine made in classic, cool-climate style. Zesty citrus and passionfruit aromas reveal honeydew melon, grapefruit and lime flavors that are accented by spice and mineral notes on the palate. Crisp and refreshing, this dry wine has a classic clean finish. Sutter Home Wine has been awarded 93 points - Gold from 2021 West Coast Wine and 91 points - Gold from 2021 Monterey Int'l. This California wine pairs well with tarragon shrimp, thyme-roasted chicken and linguine with pesto. This wine features grapes sourced from California vineyards. Made in a classic, cool-climate style this wine is cold-fermented and aged exclusively in temperature-controlled stainless steel tanks. Presented in mini wine bottles with a screw cap, this wine is convenient to open without a corkscrew. This four pack of bottled wine has 13.5% alcohol by volume. Sutter Home, family owned since 1948, is the brand generations of wine lovers trust to deliver consistent, award-winning quality and value for every wine occasion.

brandHighlight.data: Our meticulously designed St. Helena winery is an enduring symbol of everything our family has worked toward for over 70 years. It represents three generations committed to crafting wine of the utmost quality. It is a beacon, heralding both our roots and our future in the Napa Valley. With stunning views of Spring Mountain to the west and Howell Mountain to the east, our winery sits at the heart of Napa Valley, not far from where Mario Trinchero lived when he arrived in California over 70 years ago. The 22-acre site houses our winery, tasting room and hospitality center—all overlooking the Cabernet Sauvignon vines on Mario’s Vineyard. The winery is a work of art unto itself—the perfect place to craft our estate-grown, limited production wines. Every detail of its design was conceived to create wines of exceptional caliber, from the sophisticated cold grape storage and sorting equipment, to the small fermentation tanks used for isolating especially promising lots. Our wines reflect our most pristine, estate-grown grapes, thoughtfully tended in the vineyard and ultimately hand-picked and scrupulously hand-sorted in the cellar. Following fermentation, we stay close to our wines as they age. Our barrel room is home to oak barrels from some of the most respected coopers in France. Hundreds of small steps are taken every day to ensure we create truly unique wines, handcrafted with care and integrity. We focus on small-lot winemaking, with unwavering attention to detail, to yield luxury wines that embody quality and dedication to the craft.

description.data: Trinchero Napa Valley Mary's Sauvignon Blanc Wine has aromas of lemon blossom, lime zest, fresh white peach and juicy honeydew melon. Sustainably farmed in Calistoga, this white wine has textural richness and vibrant acidity, with flavors of crisp green apple and other orchard fruit balanced by a refreshing minerality. This wine received 92 points from Wine Enthusiast in 2021. Aged for 6 months in a combination of stainless steel and French oak to add well integrated aromas of toasty oak to the finished wine. This Sauvignon Blanc pairs well with poultry, fish, shellfish, soups and salad. This bottle of wine has 14.4% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: In a corner of the world steeped in heritage, yet unrestrained by convention, Taken crafts their wine entirely from Napa Valley fruit. They view this traditional region through a decidedly of-the-moment lens, capturing the unmatched terroir of Napa as an ever-evolving narrative. A story of flavor, complexity and depth.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Taken Chardonnay White Wine boasts a beautiful nose of spice, citrus and lemon blossom. On the palate, Asian pear, grapefruit and Gravenstein apple are rounded out with hints of butterscotch and walnut. The mouthfeel is juicy, though not too heavy, with an uplifting, refreshing, crisp finish. Bright Napa Valley acidity is balanced out with creaminess coming from a splash of Sonoma fruit. The 2019 vintage received 91 points from James Suckling in 2021. Sourced from the renowned Napa Valley, this Chardonnay showcases the charm and essence of this region. After being picked in the early morning hours, grapes were brought into the winery for processing. After undergoing native yeast fermentation half of the wine went through malolactic fermentation, rounding out the palate and adding a delicious, creamy note. The wine was then aged in French and American oak barrels (30% new) for 9 months. Pair this wine with grilled salmon or shellfish accompanied with rice and vegetables. One 750mL bottle of Taken Chardonnay White Wine has 14.1% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: The driving force behind boutique Napa Valley brand ZIATA, Karen Cakebread relishes every small step that brings a wine from vineyard to table. After 20 years of marketing Napa Valley and its wines, she launched ZIATA Wines in 2008. “I had two goals: to create beautifully structured wines that reflect the vineyards they come from; and to be involved in every aspect making wine.” She named the brand in honor of her mother, Mary Annunziata.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Ziata Pinot Noir Red Wine is rich, silky and opens with spicy aromas of nutmeg, allspice and pepper mingling with notes of ripe black cherry, forest floor and cedar. The wine is fresh on the palate, with dark fruit, notes of chocolate and a subtle sweetness all framed by refined tannins that lead into a lingering finish. The 2019 vintage received 90 points from James Suckling in the March 2022 issue. This well-balanced wine pairs with a gamut of foods, from salmon, tuna, roast chicken or pork, to wild mushrooms or beef Wellington. This red wine is grown on the Sonoma Coast. The cooler spring weather, followed by moderate summer temperatures, and warm days in the runup to harvest resulted in smaller, looser clusters that produced very flavorful and concentrated wines with silky, refined tannins. This red wine was aged 12 months in French oak barrels [40% New] and [60% Neutral]. One 750mL wine bottle of Ziata Pinot Noir Red Wine, 14.6% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: For more than 150 years, fortune seekers have been lured to California’s rugged Sierra Foothills. Though they once came for the gold, these days they come for the wine—Terra d’Oro, to be more specific. Handcrafted from some of Amador County’s most historic vineyards, Terra d’Oro wines are rich, full of the character and intensity that perfectly captures the essence of this “Land of Gold.” With 400 acres of magnificent estate vines—including several historic, old-vine vineyards—Terra d’Oro now produces delicious Pinot Grigio, Moscato, Chenin Viognier, Barbera, Sangiovese, Petite Sirah, Zinfandel and more. We’re incredibly fortunate to be part of the long history established here.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Terra d’Oro Deaver Zinfandel Red Wine displays the classic characteristics unique to this region. This California red wine showcases enticing aromas of violet, black cherry, raspberry and a spice box of clove, anise and cracked black pepper. An elegant entry with red fruit boasts midpalate of black licorice, chewy tannins and a long floral and mineral finish. The 2019 vintage received 94 points from Wine Enthusiast in 2022. This dry red wine pairs beautifully with eggplant parmesan or grilled chicken skewers. Hand-selected grapes from the prestigious Deaver vineyards comprise Terra d’Oro Zinfandel, the winery’s flagship wine. These vineyards feature shallow topsoils, granite hardpan, hot summer days and cool summer nights, creating a remarkable home for the winemaker’s favorite varietal. Aged in French oak, resulting in subtle clove notes with indications of exotic spice. Terra d’Oro is one of Amador County’s elite producers known for critically acclaimed Zinfandels, refreshing whites and classic Italian varietals. This bottled wine has 15.5% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: AMERICA'S #1 ALCOHOL REMOVED WINE! When you—or your guests—opt not to drink alcohol, Fre delivers a refined alternative to blasé sodas and flavored water. We craft our delicious, alcohol-removed wines for everyday enjoyment, whether you’re relaxing on the couch mid-week or hosting an elegant baby shower. Every sip of Fre reflects California’s acclaimed wine regions. We make our wine using traditional methods, then we carefully remove the alcohol, while preserving the wine’s delicate flavors. The result is the perfect wine experience—without the alcohol.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: FRE Alcohol-Removed Sparkling Rosé is produced from premium California wine. A crisp and refreshing sparkling pink, alcohol-removed wine with notes of delicious ripe strawberries and citrus. This bubbly is beautifully balanced with a dry, refreshing finish. Each FRE canned wine is crafted using traditional winemaking methods. Once crafted, the wine goes through state-of-the-art spinning cone technology to remove the alcohol while safeguarding the fragile wine aromas and flavors. The finished product is a fresh, delicious beverage with the characteristic aromas and flavors of premium wine without the alcohol. Four 250mL cans of FRE Alcohol-Removed Sparkling Rosé wine has less than 0.5% alcohol by volume and half the calories of regular wine.

brandHighlight.data: Tres Agaves Tequila is 100% de Agave, USDA Certified Organic made in Amatitán, Tequila Valley, Mexico, the historic birthplace of Tequila. Its Blue Weber Agave is grown and harvested by a single source, then fermented and distilled using traditional methods. Tres Agaves Organic Blanco is unaged while Tres Agaves Organic Reposado is aged 9 months in former Tennessee Whiskey and Kentucky Bourbon barrels and Tres Agaves Organic Anejo is aged 18 months exclusively in Kentucky Bourbon barrels. Tres Agaves Organic Tequilas are perfect for sipping or mixing into classic cocktails. Tres Agaves Cocktail Mixers are USDA Certified Organic, low calorie, low glycemic index, and naturally delicious. They contain simple, easy to pronounce ingredients and contain no high fructose corn syrup (HFCS). Simply add Tres Agaves Tequila or your favorite premium Vodka or Rum. Tres Agaves Cocktail Mixers are highly awarded and one of the fastest growing mixer brands in the US.

description.data: Tres Agaves Organic Mango Chili Margarita Mix makes it easy to create real, organic margaritas at home. This USDA Certified Organic, gluten free, low calorie, low glycemic index mixer is made with simple, all-natural ingredients, like organic mango puree, organic chili puree, agave nectar and lemon juice. With 70 calories per serving, this margarita mixer creates a natural, great tasting margarita that's free from high fructose corn syrup. It's no wonder Tres Agaves Margarita Mixers are highly awarded and one of the fastest growing mixer brands in the US. Instead of hiding the unique flavor profile of Tres Agaves tequila, this margarita mix enhances it. Simply shake Tres Agaves margarita mix with Tres Agaves Organic 100% de Agave Tequila and serve in your favorite rocks glass. Tres Agaves Organic Margarita Mix does not contain alcohol. Refrigerate the bottle after opening. In Tequila Valley, we trust.

brandHighlight.data: It takes just the right amount of sunlight and cooling breezes to create the fresh, alluring flavors in our wines. Pomelo founders Randy and Megan Mason have always understood California’s inherent gifts: sun-filled vineyards, coastal air and remarkable soil. Since 2004, they’ve crafted bright, expressive wines that faithfully convey their varietal character and embody the mix of sun and soil that makes California’s vineyards like no other. Enjoy Pomelo Sauvignon Blanc by the glass or paired with your next fresh dish.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Pomelo Sauvignon Blanc White Wine is a crisp and refreshing wine that offers a pure expression of Pomelo's diverse vineyards. Bright and vibrant in the glass, this dry white wine offers fragrant white blossoms on the nose, framed by a refreshing palate of melon, white peach, lemon curd and ripe citrus. Pomelo Sauvignon Blanc wine earned 89 points from the Tasting Panel. Try this white wine with briny oysters or a summer salad topped with tangy goat cheese. Slow and even ripening in California’s sun-drenched vineyards gives these Sauvignon Blanc grapes plenty of time to develop their signature crisp acidity. Each vineyard block is fermented in stainless steel tanks to preserve the clean, fresh fruit character of the grapes. This bottled wine has 13% alcohol by volume. Pomelo Winemaker Randy Mason crafts bright, expressive wines that faithfully convey their varietal character and embody the mix of sun and soil that makes California’s vineyards like no other.

brandHighlight.data: Our timeless American story dates back three generations to when the Trinchero family left their home in New York City to pursue the American Dream in Napa Valley. The family purchased Sutter Home Winery in 1948, after the winery had been closed for almost 30 years due to Prohibition. Still family-owned and now celebrating our 75th anniversary this year, Sutter Home has a long history of delivering wine that people love, starting with the creation of the original White Zinfandel in the 1970s. Sutter Home is proud to be the brand generations of wine lovers trust to deliver consistent, award-winning quality and value for every wine occasion. We were honored to be awarded the Distinguished Service Award for “having introduced more Americans to wine on the table than anyone in history” from Wine Spectator. We will forever stand by our promise to create “a great product for a fair price.”

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Sutter Home Merlot Red Wine is a full-bodied, silky-smooth red wine with delicious fruit characteristics, soft tannins and a rounded mouthfeel. Ripe black cherry aromas with hints of tobacco and herbal spice lead to smoky black cherry and spiced plum flavors on the palate. Sutter Home Merlot wine has earned 90 points - Gold from 2023 Toast of the Coast Wine Competition and Triple Gold-Best of Class from 2022 Dan Berger's International Wine Competition. This dry red wine pairs well with herb-roasted chicken, spaghetti Bolognese and mushroom risotto. The wine making process starts with grapes from premier vineyards in cool coastal regions and warmer inland regions of California. This dry wine is fermented in stainless steel tanks at cool temperatures to preserve its vivid cherry flavors and aromas. This four pack of mini bottled wine has 13.4% alcohol by volume and comes with screw caps for easy opening. Sutter Home, family owned since 1948, is the brand generations of wine lovers trust to deliver consistent, award-winning quality and value for every wine occasion.

brandHighlight.data: Founded in 1996 by Joel Gott, a 4th generation California vintner, Joel Gott Wines is rooted in authenticity and is committed to crafting fruit-forward, balanced, delicious wines for people to enjoy.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Joel Gott Washington Red Wine contains fruit sourced from varied appellations across Washington's Columbia Valley to create an elegant and well-balanced wine. This red wine showcases aromas of dark berries and dark chocolate. Flavors of black licorice, smooth tannins and notes of cacao on the long, delicate finish. A Washington wine that can be enjoyed with grilled steak or hamburgers. Joel Gott Wines selects the best fruit from a variety of growing regions and blends them to create more balanced, clean, complex and elegant wines that are food friendly and affordable. This Washington red wine is aged in 75% new American oak and 25% two-year-old American oak. One 750mL wine bottle of Joel Gott Washington Red Wine has 13.9% alcohol by volume. Together, the small, dynamic team at Joel Gott Wines shares the same love and dedication for wine making. Since 1996, Joel Gott Wines have all the things that matter: structure, sweet fruit, tannins, color, mouthfeel, and they have a great time making it.

brandHighlight.data: Ménage à Trois originated as a blend of three red varietals, created in 1996 by two psychiatric professionals in St. Helena, California. Capturing wine lovers’ imagination through word of mouth, the offering was soon expanded to white and rosé blends. Today the brand is much more then just blends, with over 20 unique offerings. Ménage à Trois continues to thrill wine fans with its unapologetically bold persona and an equally adventurous approach to flavor.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Menage a Trois Bourbon Barrel Cabernet Sauvignon Red Wine finds inspiration in the very best of California winemaking and traditional Kentucky craft distilling. Aromas of berry cobbler lead to jammy blueberry and blackberry flavors on the palate. Subtle notes of vanilla and spices meld with the full-bodied flavors of this Cabernet wine that's beautifully structured with a rich mouthfeel and a lingering finish. The 2018 vintage received 92 Points at the 2020 Sunset International Wine Competition. Enjoy this limited release dry red wine with barbecued meats and smoked vegetables. Grapes used in the wine making process are sourced from Lodi and Delta growing regions, an area of California known for producing fruit with rich, soulful flavors. This California wine is aged for three months in oak barrels previously used to craft 6 year-old Kentucky bourbon, lending a unique, indulgent flavor profile in every wine bottle. This bottled wine has 14.8% alcohol by volume. Menage a Trois offers a robust portfolio of award-winning wines that consistently delight with a high-quality experience.

brandHighlight.data: Trincheri Vermouth is based on the original 1890’s Trinchero family recipe from Piedmont, Italy. Today, grapes sourced from Trinchero owned vineyards, Barbera in Amador County and Chardonnay in Napa Valley, make up the expressions in Rosso while Dry is sourced from Bullfrog Vineyard French Colombard in Central Valley, also owned by Trinchero Family Estates. Trincheri Rosso and Dry Vermouth are both infused with Roman Artemisia and Cinchona Bark bitter herbs along with other fruits, botanicals, and spices that have been cold macerated for over a month. Bob Trinchero, Trinchero Family Estates Chairman Emeritus and Wine Spectator Distinguished Service Honoree, re-created Trincheri Vermouth. It’s a vibrant vermouth with the perfect balance of bitterness, sweetness, and flavor complexity.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Based on the original family recipe from the 1890’s, Trincheri Dry Vermouth is made from French Colombard grapes and infused with 13 herbs, spices, fruits, and botanicals, including: Roman Artemisia, Cinchona Bark, Orris Root, Tansy Herb, Ceylon Cinnamon, Lemon Peel, Juniper Berries, Yarrow Flower. The result is a vibrant dry vermouth with the perfect balance of bitterness, sweetness, and flavor complexity. Trincheri Vermouth received 91 points an Gold from San Diego International Wine & Spirits Challenge. Best Vermouth for Martini or Gibson cocktail. This bottle of Vermouth has 17.5% alcohol by volume.

description.data: From its deep, ruby red color to its alluring blueberry cordial fragrance, Menage a Trois Lavish Merlot promises to be much more than a typical Merlot. On the palate, dry wine with rich, ripe flavors of blueberries and juicy black plums flirt with dark cocoa and sensual vanilla notes. Smooth, dark and plush, this dry red wine is full-bodied with a soft, round mouthfeel for a uniquely rich, extraordinarily lavish Merlot wine. The 2018 vintage received 90 Points from the Jerry Mead New World Wine Competition in 2020. Pair this California wine with pork, hamburgers or mushroom dishes. Grapes from premier California vineyards on the Central Coast and North Coast go into the wine making process, and they're fermented on French and American oak to round out the flavors and mouthfeel. This bottled wine has 13.5% alcohol by volume. Menage a Trois offers a robust portfolio of award-winning wines that consistently delight with a high-quality experience.

brandHighlight.data: Quattro Theory represents Landon Donley’s ideal set of four elements combined to deliver an exceptional Napa Valley wine: intentional vision, quality vineyards, precision winemaking and experience with food and friends.  Landon’s thoughtful approach marries classic and contemporary techniques in the vineyard and winery. Quattro Theory wines are seriously made to be easily enjoyed.

description.data: Quattro Theory Chardonnay White Wine  is a traditional Napa Valley Chardonnay with balanced acidity, minimal oak and non-malolactic fermentation. This white wine is expressive in flavor, highlighting a full range of varietal fruit expression and restrained oak presence with a balanced structure and complexity. Pair this white wine with pan-seared scallops, butternut squash ravioli and mushroom, mozzarella pizza. These grapes are grown in two vineyards: Vista Montone Vineyard (70% of blend) located east of Carneros, and a vineyard in the southernmost part of Carneros called Frasamani (30% of blend). This wine was aged 6 months in 80% stainless steel tanks, 16% French oak barrel {10% new}, and 4% concrete. One 750mL bottle of Quattro Theory Chardonnay contains 13.5% alcohol by volume.

Still family-owned, Sutter Home has a long history of delivering wine that people love, starting with the creation of the original White Zinfandel in the 1970s. We were honored to be awarded the Distinguished Service Award for “having introduced more Americans to wine on the table than anyone in history” from Wine Spectator. We will forever stand by our promise to create “a great product for a fair price.”

brandHighlight.data: Trincheri Vermouth is based on the original 1890’s Trinchero family recipe from Piedmont, Italy. Today, grapes sourced from Trinchero owned vineyards, Barbera in Amador County and Chardonnay in Napa Valley, make up the expressions in Rosso while Dry is sourced from Bullfrog Vineyard French Colombard in Central Valley, also owned by Trinchero Family Estates. Trincheri Rosso and Dry Vermouth are both infused with Roman Artemisia and Cinchona Bark bitter herbs along with other fruits, botanicals, and spices that have been cold macerated for over a month. Bob Trinchero, Trinchero Family Estates Chairman Emeritus and Wine Spectator Distinguished Service Honoree, re-created Trincheri Vermouth. It’s a vibrant vermouth with the perfect balance of bitterness, sweetness, and flavor complexity.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Based on the original family recipe from the 1890’s, Trincheri Rosso Sweet Vermouth is bright and deeply aromatic. It is the perfect balance of bitterness, sweetness and flavor complexity. This Vermouth is made from Barbera and Chardonnay grapes and infused with 19 herbs, spices, fruit and botanicals including: Roman Artemisia, Cinchona Bark, Ginger Root, Burmannii Cinnamon, Whole Clove & Nutmeg, Orange & Lemon Peel, Vanilla Bean, Star Anise. The result is a vibrant Vermouth with the perfect balance of bitterness, acidity and baking spices. Trincheri Sweet Vermouth received 94 points from Wine Enthusiast in 2019. Best Vermouth for a Manhattan, Negroni, or Rob Roy. This bottle of Vermouth has 17.5% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: Amador Whiskey Company, is passionate about making limited-production, luxury whiskey. Their first creation was Amador Whiskey 10-Barrel, a California straight hop-flavored whiskey crafted with a craft California IPA beer and finished in Napa Cellars Chardonnay barrels. Their second offering, Amador Whiskey Co. Double Barrel, marries the best of Kentucky whiskey with different wine barrel finishes. They hope you enjoy these exceptional whiskies as much as they enjoyed creating them.

text.data: Distilled spirits like whiskey, vodka, gin, rum and tequila: Slightly cooler than room temperature, at 55-60 degrees Fahrenheit / 13-16 degrees Celsius.

description.data: Amador Whiskey Ten Barrels Limited Release Hop-Flavored Whiskey is aged in ten barrels over four years. This whiskey is a blend of 90% straight malt and 10% hop-infused whiskey distilled from craft IPA beer, resulting in a satisfying spirit that speaks to its origins. Both elements are aged separately for over two years in French oak wine barrels before joining forces in Amador Whiskey Co.’s family Chardonnay barrels for another two years. The taste changes whether enjoyed neat, over ice, or in a whiskey-based cocktail. Tasting neat will bring rich flavors of caramel, cloves and vanilla on the palate with an extra-long finish. With a bit of ice, the hoppy IPA flavors are coaxed out, blending smoothly with those classic whiskey notes, perfect for hot summer days when an ice cold beer is the only thing on your mind. This is a drink to take your time with - to savor the flavors that will only deepen with age. Amador Whiskey Co. recommends cellaring a case of this limited release, for enjoyment over the next 20 to 30 years. One 750mL bottle of Amador Whiskey Ten Barrels Limited Release Hop-Flavored Whiskey is 96 Proof, 48% alcohol by volume.

description.data: Joel Gott Santa Barbara Pinot Noir Red Wine contains fruit sourced from Santa Barbara County. This red wine showcases aromas of plum, cherries and raspberries with notes of toasted oak and spices. The wine features flavors of ripe, dark cherries with velvety tannins and a long finish. A California wine that can easily be enjoyed with lamb chops or salmon. Joel Gott Wines selects the best fruit from a variety of growing regions and blends them to create more balanced, clean, complex and elegant wines that are food friendly and affordable. These grapes are sources from Santa Barbara county and aged in 33% new French oak and 67% one and two year-old French oak. One 750mL wine bottle of Joel Gott Santa Barbara Pinot Noir Red Wine has 14.5% alcohol by volume. Together, the small, dynamic team at Joel Gott Wines shares the same love and dedication for wine making. Since 1996, Joel Gott Wines have all the things that matter: structure, sweet fruit, tannins, color, mouthfeel, and they have a great time making it.

brandHighlight.data: Tres Agaves Tequila is 100% de Agave, USDA Certified Organic made in Amatitán, Tequila Valley, Mexico, the historic birthplace of Tequila. Its Blue Weber Agave is grown and harvested by a single source, then fermented and distilled using traditional methods. Tres Agaves Organic Blanco is unaged while Tres Agaves Organic Reposado is aged 9 months in former Tennessee Whiskey and Kentucky Bourbon barrels and Tres Agaves Organic Anejo is aged 18 months exclusively in Kentucky Bourbon barrels. Tres Agaves Organic Tequilas are perfect for sipping or mixing into classic cocktails. Tres Agaves Cocktail Mixers are USDA Certified Organic, low calorie, low glycemic index, and naturally delicious. They contain simple, easy to pronounce ingredients and contain no high fructose corn syrup (HFCS). Simply add Tres Agaves Tequila or your favorite premium Vodka or Rum. Tres Agaves Cocktail Mixers are highly awarded and one of the fastest growing mixer brands in the US.

text.data: Distilled spirits like whiskey, vodka, gin, rum and tequila: Slightly cooler than room temperature, at 55-60 degrees Fahrenheit / 13-16 degrees Celsius.

description.data: Tres Agaves Organic Bloody Mary Mix makes a great cocktail, whether you're brunching with friends on a Sunday or watching some football. This Bloody Mary mix is crafted with organic, all natural ingredients, including organic tomato, lemon, agave, vinegar, spices, lime and salt. An award-winning addition to your cocktail mixers, Tres Agaves Bloody Mary Mix won Gold at the Los Angeles International Competition. Featuring bold, spicy flavors, Tres Agaves Bloody Mary mixer really captures the spirit of Mexico, and it complements both vodka and the bolder flavor profile of tequila. For a classic cocktail, combine this Bloody Mary mixer with Hanson Organic Vodka or your favorite vodka and a squeeze of lemon juice, and serve over ice in your favorite Collins glass. Bloody Mary cocktails pair well with almost any food, so try them alongside vegetable omelets, huevos rancheros or spicy meats and bacon. Tres Agaves Organic Bloody Mary Mix does not contain alcohol. Refrigerate the bottle after opening. In Tequila Valley, we trust.

brandHighlight.data: Angove was founded in 1886 by Dr. William Thomas Angove who emigrated with his family from Cornwall, England to Adelaide, South Australia. Dr. Angove established a medical practice and started experimenting making wine as a tonic for his patients. He soon found a growing customer base that turned his hobby into a business. Today, Angove Family Winemakers is a 5th Generation, family owned winery with a dedication to creating premium wines from across South Australia’s best regions with a focus on McLaren Vale. Most of the wines are single vineyard sourced, with only a few hundred cases (or less) of each vintage imported into the U.S. Angove is currently the largest producer of organic wines in Australia.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Naturalis Organic Chardonnay White Wine has a soft green, yellow with cornhusk hues. This vegan friendly wine has an appealing balance between fresh fruit flavors and floral aromatics, with pure pineapple, peach and melon notes, details of orange blossom and a hint of spice and black tea. This white wine has subtle oak that leads to a soft full palate finishing with richness and length. Grapes for this wine have been entirely sourced from their Certified Organic Nanya Vineyard near Paringa, South Australia. The sandy loam over limestone soils, abundant sunshine, warm days and cool nights provide ideal conditions for nurturing flavor packed organic grapes with which to craft this exciting new, organic wine. At no stage during the grape growing and winemaking of Naturalis Organic wines have they used any synthetic pesticides, herbicides, fungicides, fertilizers or inputs of any kind. Everything they use comes from nature, pure and clean. The 2020 vintage Chardonnay received 90 points from The Tasting Panel, 89 points from Wine Enthusiast and 88 points from Wine Spectator. This Australian wine pairs well with Korean style organic beef parcels or Greek inspired veggie bake. Perfectly ripened Organic Chardonnay grapes were picked at various stages of ripeness to add extra dimension and character to the finished wine. The free-run juice was extracted using delicate membrane presses at our Certified Organic winery. The slightly cloudy juice which was then transferred to cooled tanks and fermentation was initiated after a short period of settling to remove any heavy solids. Once dry the wine received a light filtration prior to bottling in our own bottling facility. One bottled wine of Naturalis Organic Chardonnay has 13% alcohol by volume.

description.data: Naturalis Organic Sauvignon Blanc has a bright and clear green hue. This vegan friendly wine has aromas of apple, passionfruit and lychee with light lilting notes of white melon. Grapes for this wine have been entirely sourced from their Certified Organic Nanya Vineyard near Paringa, South Australia. The sandy loam over limestone soils, abundant sunshine, warm days and cool nights provide ideal conditions for nurturing flavor packed organic grapes with which to craft this exciting new, organic wine. At no stage during the grape growing and winemaking of Naturalis Organic wines have they used any synthetic pesticides, herbicides, fungicides, fertilizers or inputs of any kind. Everything they use comes from nature, pure and clean. The 2020 vintage Sauvignon Blanc received 90 points from The Tasting Panel Magazine. This Australian white wine pairs well with a wild, line caught, baked barramundi with spring greens or vegan Singapore noodles. Perfectly ripened Organic Sauvignon Blanc grapes were picked in the soft light of dawn to ensure they were as cool as possible and minimize any oxidative spoilage. On arrival at their Certified Organic winery they were gently pressed to extract the flavor-filled, cloudy free-run juice which was immediately transferred to cooled stainless steel tanks and allowed to settle any “solids”. The clear juice was removed and fermented under temperature controlled conditions to preserve the delicate aromas and flavors in the wine. The wine received a light filtration prior to bottling in their own Certified Organic winery. One bottled wine of Naturalis Organic Sauvignon Blanc has 12.5% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: Of Cherokee descent, winemaker Derek Rohlffs was gifted the name “Winter Hawk” as a young boy. Intuitively connected to the land—Cherokee means “those who live in the mountains”—Derek has always felt a mysterious pull to nature, even as a child. To hear him tell it, the vineyard is his destiny. He doesn’t view his path to winemaking as a conscious choice, but more of an undercurrent that quietly ushered him to where he belongs. Today, Derek welcomes the sight of hawks circling over the vineyards and swooping down to the earth around him. A single hawk’s feather fittingly graces the Bravium label, echoing the power, elegance, and vitality of the wines—and of Derek’s Cherokee roots.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Created by winemaker Derek Rohlffs, Bravium is the culmination of meticulous care in the vineyards and a patient approach in the cellar. Derek takes his cues from tradition. He doesn’t alter what the earth gives him. He’s a classic minimalist. Compelling, terroir–driven wines that pair naturally with food and have rare aging potential relative to their Pinot Noir peers. Native yeast naturally initiate a slow, cool fermentation and diligent attention to detail with generous amount of restraint guide the wine to its full potential. Bravium is a Latin word meaning prize, gift or reward.

text.data: This vineyard is renowned for its bucolic setting and elegant, finessed wines from 40 year old vines. This powerful wine is characterized by fresh red apple, strawberry, and raspberry fruit, with woodsmoke, damp soil, and pennyroyal tea notes. A soft, juicy entry delivers intense cherry flavors, with a touch of mocha and spice.
Velvet-textured, with medium acidity and fine-grained tannins, the earthy finish serves up saline minerality that speaks to this wine's coastal vineyard origins.
The 2019 vintage received 92 points from Wine Enthusiast and 91 points from the Wine Spectator
This pinot noir red wine pairs with grilled salmon with mushroom sauce, mushroom risotto, herb chicken, roast duck or beef bourguignon

Wiley Vineyard was planted in 1972 in the famed “Deep End”, the westernmost portion of Anderson Valley. Wiley is a true cool-climate site, resting on benchlands just nine miles from the Pacific Ocean.
This Pinot Noir red wine is aged in French and Hungarian oak

brandHighlight.data: Our timeless American story dates back three generations to when the Trinchero family left their home in New York City to pursue the American Dream in Napa Valley. The family purchased Sutter Home Winery in 1948, after the winery had been closed for almost 30 years due to Prohibition. Still family-owned, Sutter Home has a long history of delivering wine that people love, starting with the creation of the original White Zinfandel in the 1970s. Sutter Home is proud to be the brand generations of wine lovers trust to deliver consistent, award-winning quality and value for every wine occasion. We were honored to be awarded the Distinguished Service Award for “having introduced more Americans to wine on the table than anyone in history” from Wine Spectator. We will forever stand by our promise to create “a great product for a fair price.”

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Sutter Home White Zinfandel Wine looks as good as it tastes with its beautiful pale pink color. Delicate aromas of sun-ripened berries lead to sweet, creamy strawberry and melon flavors that mingle with a hint of vanilla on the palate. The crisp, refreshing finish balances out this lightly sweet rose wine. Awards for this California wine include the 2018 San Diego International with 90 Points - Gold, 2018 Toast of the Coast Best Sweet Rose - Gold and 2019 Ultimate Wine with 90 Points. Pair this pink wine with spicy Asian cuisine, shrimp cocktail and grilled chicken. The grapes for Sutter Home wine are pressed immediately after harvesting to create the pale pink color and a touch of sweetness. During the wine making process, winemakers cold-ferment this blush wine in stainless steel tanks to enhance the fresh aromas, fruity flavors and crisp acidity. This wine has 9.8% alcohol by volume.

description.data: Sutter Home Moscato Wine is a sweet, creamy, luxurious wine. Delicate aromas of white peaches and exotic lychee on the nose lead to creamy peach and juicy melon flavors with hints of caramel on the palate. Refreshing acidity and a vivid, crisp finish balance the luxuriously sweet flavors. Sutter Home Wine has been awarded Reserve Class Champion, Double Gold - 2019 Houston Livestock & Rodeo and Best of Class - 2019 San Francisco International and 90 points - Gold from 2020 San Diego International. Pair it with light cheeses, barbecued ribs or spicy grilled shrimp. This table white wine features grapes sourced from California vineyards. To craft this lovely wine, winemakers cap and drain the juice to increase the varietal intensity and forego malolactic fermentation to maintain the wines refreshing acidity. It's then cold fermented and aged in stainless steel tanks. Wine bottles come with a screw cap for easy opening without a corkscrew, and these mini bottles are shatterproof and recyclable. This four pack of mini bottled wine has 10.1% alcohol by volume. Sutter Home, family owned since 1948, is the brand generations of wine lovers trust to deliver consistent, award-winning quality and value for every wine occasion.

brandHighlight.data: Ménage à Trois originated as a blend of three red varietals, created in 1996 by two psychiatric professionals in St. Helena, California. Capturing wine lovers’ imagination through word of mouth, the offering was soon expanded to white and rosé blends. Today the brand is much more then just blends, with over 20 unique offerings. Ménage à Trois continues to thrill wine fans with its unapologetically bold persona and an equally adventurous approach to flavor.

description.data: Enjoy a regal romp with the King of Reds when you sip Menage a Trois Cabernet Sauvignon Red Wine. Made in a smooth, approachable style, this dry red wine reigns supreme with lush, bold, dark berry flavors, exquisite silky tannins and a long, sumptuous finish. The 2018 vintage received 90 Points at the 2020 San Diego International Wine Competition. Pair Menage a Trois Cabernet Sauvignon with beef short ribs, meatballs and steak with salsa verde. This wine is made using grapes sourced from California's legendary North Coast wine growing region, bringing beautiful finesse, swagger and charm to the mix. After barrel aging in French and American oak, this Cabernet Sauvignon red wine emerges, garnet-hued and regal, ready to make you its latest conquest. This bottled wine has 13.8% alcohol by volume. Menage a Trois offers a robust portfolio of award-winning wines that consistently delight with a high-quality experience.

brandHighlight.data: Tres Agaves Tequila is 100% de Agave, USDA Certified Organic made in Amatitán, Tequila Valley, Mexico, the historic birthplace of Tequila. Its Blue Weber Agave is grown and harvested by a single source, then fermented and distilled using traditional methods. Tres Agaves Organic Blanco is unaged while Tres Agaves Organic Reposado is aged 9 months in former Tennessee Whiskey and Kentucky Bourbon barrels and Tres Agaves Organic Anejo is aged 18 months exclusively in Kentucky Bourbon barrels. Tres Agaves Organic Tequilas are perfect for sipping or mixing into classic cocktails. Tres Agaves Cocktail Mixers are USDA Certified Organic, low calorie, low glycemic index, and naturally delicious. They contain simple, easy to pronounce ingredients and contain no high fructose corn syrup (HFCS). Simply add Tres Agaves Tequila or your favorite premium Vodka or Rum. Tres Agaves Cocktail Mixers are highly awarded and one of the fastest growing mixer brands in the US.

description.data: Tres Agaves Blanco Tequila is 100% de Agave and is sourced from organic agave that's grown in the Tequila Valley and slowly roasted to perfection. Vibrant and sweet agave aromas dominate with supporting notes of citrus, pear and hints of wild mint. A pleasing taste and silky texture make this tequila ideal for sipping or mixing with Tres Agaves Organic Margarita Mix. One of the most awarded super-premium Tequilas on the market, Tres Agaves Blanco tequila earned 92 Points from the Ultimate Spirits Competition and Best Tequila for Margaritas from the Ultimate Cocktail Competition. Just add agave nectar and freshly squeezed lime juice to this tequila for a fresh margarita in minutes. Tres Agaves Blanco Tequila is crafted in Amatitan, Tequila Valley, Mexico, the true birthplace of Tequila. The tequila alcohol is slow roasted for approximately 20 hours and uses natural well water extracted from the renowned Tequila Valley aquifers and fermented in shallow tanks to allow agave flavor to present itself without the influence of wood. This 80 proof tequila has 40% alcohol by volume. In Tequila Valley, we trust.

description.data: Bravium Wiley Vineyard Blanc de Noirs Sparkling Wine has a brilliant, light copper color that has aromas of candied peach and citrus fruit with a sweet custard or cheese pastry backing. Hints of lees, herbs, and pleasant oxidation mingle with the bright, fresh fruit (i.e. a recently cut apple versus a day old apple). Energetic and intense. Texturally rich, savory and finessed with a slightly dry, but quenching finish that is exceptionally flavorful and persistent. This single vineyard Brut Nature sparkling wine is less than 3 g/L residual sugar, and was bottled unfiltered. Pair this Sparkling Wine with a delicious cheeseboard or drink on its own. Wiley Vineyard is situated in the famed “Deep End” the relatively cool, westernmost portion of Anderson Valley. This Sparkling wine was fermented and aged for 10 months in used French and Hungarian oak barrels. brandHighlight.data: Amador Whiskey Company, is passionate about making limited-production, luxury whiskey. Their first creation was Amador Whiskey 10-Barrel, a California straight hop-flavored whiskey crafted with a craft California IPA beer and finished in Napa Cellars Chardonnay barrels. Their second offering, Amador Whiskey Co. Double Barrel, marries the best of Kentucky whiskey with different wine barrel finishes. They hope you enjoy these exceptional whiskies as much as they enjoyed creating them.

text.data: Distilled spirits like whiskey, vodka, gin, rum and tequila: Slightly cooler than room temperature, at 55-60 degrees Fahrenheit / 13-16 degrees Celsius.

description.data: Amador Whiskey Co.’s Double Barrel Classic Bourbon does something a little extra—it captures the heart of Kentucky in every glass. This 72% corn small batch classic bourbon upholds the high standards of Kentucky bourbon with a deep understanding that it’s more than a spirit, but a culture—a lifestyle. Amador’s classic low-rye bourbon was aged in new charred American oak barrels for three years, taking time to soak in flavors of vanilla, caramel and mildly tart black cherry notes. Distinct from its Kentucky counterparts, Amador Whiskey Co.’s Double Barrel Classic Bourbon also captures the California spirit. The whiskey’s second barrel aging is done in Napa Valley California, where this classic drink steps into luxury, aging for 9 to 12 months in medium toast French oak Napa Cabernet Sauvignon barrels. The Cabernet aging results in a copper brown bourbon tinted with a cabernet red hue, sensational vanilla characteristics and a silky mouthfeel. The result is a rich take on a Kentucky bourbon, exuding deep flavors of vanilla and toast followed by notes of crème brûlée that conclude with hints of spice in a long, complex finish. When you reach for this bottle, you’re reaching for the Amador golden standard, whether in a Perfect Manhattan cocktail or just slow sipping nice and neat. One 750mL bottle of Amador Whiskey Double Barrel Classic Bourbon, 90 Proof, 45% alcohol by volume.

description.data: Sutter Home Pinot Grigio White Wine is always a crowd pleaser. Light, crisp and refreshing, this Pinot Grigio wine offers vibrant tropical fruit flavors and vivid acidity with a clean finish. Delicate floral notes mingle with ripe pear, peach and melon on the nose, leading to bright citrus, white peach and tropical fruit flavors. Sutter Home Wine has earned Silver from 2023 Toast of the Coast Wine Competition and 90 points - Gold from 2020 San Diego International. Serve this fruit-forward dry white wine for a variety of occasions. It pairs well with pasta primavera, citrusy salads and grilled seafood. This wine features grapes sourced from California vineyards. To enhance its fresh fruit flavors and delicate aromas, the wine is cold-fermented and aged entirely in stainless steel tanks. The eco-friendly wine pack is shatterproof and uses a screw cap for convenience without needing a corkscrew. This dry boxed wine has 13.1% alcohol by volume. brandHighlight.data: Ménage à Trois originated as a blend of three red varietals, created in 1996 by two psychiatric professionals in St. Helena, California. Capturing wine lovers’ imagination through word of mouth, the offering was soon expanded to white and rosé blends. Today the brand is much more then just blends, with over 20 unique offerings. Ménage à Trois continues to thrill wine fans with its unapologetically bold persona and an equally adventurous approach to flavor.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: This thrilling Menage a Trois Red Wine variety pack brings together three red wines. Silk is a smooth, seductive red blend of Pinot Noir, velvety soft Malbec and Petite Sirah. This full-bodied wine has succulent aromas of cherry and ripe raspberry with a delicate hint of rose petals and toasty spice. The Red Blend is forward, soft and silky and exposes fresh, ripe, jam-like fruit with bold blackberry and ripe raspberry flavors and firm tannins. A gorgeous garnet color in the glass, the mysterious, dark Midnight blend wraps you up in a velvety embrace. Blackberry and plush spiced plum flavors seduce your palate, while hints of mocha and exotic spice linger on your lips like a stolen kiss. The 2021 vintage of Silk Red Wine received 90 Points at the 2023 Toast of the Coast Competition, the 2020 vintage of the Red blend received 90 Points from the Tasting Panel in May 2023, and the 2021 vintage of the Midnight blend received 94 Points at the 2023 Toast of the Coast Competition. Pair any of these red wines with grilled meats and delectable desserts. Sourced from California grapes, each bottled wine has its own unique winemaking process to deliver a luxurious red blend red wine. Silk has 13.5% alcohol by volume, Red Blend has 13.75% alcohol by volume, and Midnight has 13.5% alcohol by volume. Menage a Trois offers a robust portfolio of award-winning wines that consistently delight with a high-quality experience.

brandHighlight.data:
Morrows honors the influence of both land and sea on this unique appellation and its wines.
The name denotes the promise of coming days, as well as an ancient Scottish sea god—our
nod to the marine influence that is key to the pure varietal character and fruit intensity of the
region’s wines. The label represents the meeting of earth and ocean, and the significance
of both, in this exceptional, single-vineyard Chardonnay from the acclaimed Santa Lucia
Highlands AVA.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Morrows Saint Lucia Chardonnay white wine has a brilliant yellow gold color in the glass, the wine opens with aromas of apple, white peaches, saltwater taffy and white flowers. On the palate, the wine's soft, juicy entry leads into delicious apple, nectarine, apricot and lemon meringue flavors with nascent depth and a lightly creamy texture. This evolves pleasingly into racy acidity and a minerality that builds on the back half to a finish that is clean, crisp and vivacious. The 2019 vintage received 91 points from James Suckling in the June 2021 issue. This wine pairs beautifully with fish, shellfish, poultry and white meat, whether simply grilled or served in a luscious cream sauce. Tucked against the Santa Lucia Mountains south of Monterey Bay, the Santa Lucia Highlands AVA is the source of some of America’s most renowned single-vineyard Chardonnays and Pinot Noirs. The wine then aged 10 months in used barrels. Oak fermentation and aging add a rounder, creamier flavor and texture component to the bright, vibrant elements. One 750mL wine bottle of Morrows Santa Lucia Chardonnay White Wine, 13.1% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: Founded in 1996 by Joel Gott, a 4th generation California vintner, Joel Gott Wines is rooted in authenticity and is committed to crafting fruit-forward, balanced, delicious wines for people to enjoy.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Joel Gott Zinfandel Red Wine is sourced from varied regions across California to create an elegant and well-balanced wine. This red Zinfandel wine showcases aromas of brambleberries, red currants and plum with velvety tannings and a long finish. Each sip opens with dark fruit flavors and vanilla, followed by velvety tannins on the mid-palate and a long finish with hints of spice. A red wine that can easily be enjoyed on its own or with a variety of dishes, Joel Gott Zinfandel red wine pairs well with birria tacos or Korean BBQ. Sourced from vineyards in Lodi, Sierra, Foothills, and Contra Costa. This California wine reflects unique characteristics from each appellation. Following harvest, the fruit was fermented in individual lots then blended together to balance the characteristics of each grape growing region. After fermentation, the wine was aged in 20% new American oak and 80% two year-old French oak. One 750mL wine bottle of Joel Gott Zinfandel Red Wine has 14.4% alcohol by volume. Since 1996, Joel Gott has made wines with everything that matters: structure, sweet fruit, tannin, color, mouthfeel.

brandHighlight.data: Wines bearing the Trinchero Napa Valley label are luxury-class, predominantly single-vineyard wines from the family’s Napa Valley estates. Grapes are sourced from 200+ acres of estate vineyards in prime Napa Valley appellations, including St. Helena, Mt. Veeder, Rutherford and Atlas Peak. Nestled north of the town of St. Helena, the winery is a work of art unto itself. Every detail of its design was conceived to create wines of exceptional caliber. Small-lot and terroir driven, these wines embody the Trinchero Family legacy.

Bright flavors of raspberry jam, tobacco and fig are complemented with a soft texture, rich mid-palate and a polished finish. Mario’s Cabernet Sauvignon is Sustainably sourced from two estate vineyards situated in the heart of Napa Valley. Central Park West Vineyard rests on the valley floor at the southern end of the St. Helena appellation. Ample sunshine and deep loam and alluvial soils, is well-suited for growing classic red Bordeaux varieties. This red wine received 95 points from Decanter in 2021. Pair this luxurious wine with steak and potatoes, short ribs and polenta or grilled Portobello mushrooms. This bottle of wine has 14.8% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: Created in 1992 by Bruce and Barbara Neyers, Neyers Vineyards takes its cues from classic French winemaking philosophies. Sitting in the heart of Napa Valley, they make their wines naturally without use of cultured yeast or laboratory designed malolactic starter, and bottle their wines without fining or filtration. Our wines are aged with as little intervention as possible, and in most years we bottle our wines with neither fining nor filtration, using a state of the art mobile bottling line. Neyers wines express pure varietal character and terroir.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Neyers Sage Canyon California Red Wine has aromas of exotic, lavender-like aroma, with suggestions of wild cherries, ginger, allspice, and freshly ground pepper. The flavors are generous and rich, matched by an attractive suppleness that adds to their enjoyment. The 2018 vintage received 91 points from the Wine Spectator and Wine Enthusiast. This red wine blend pairs well with a pot roast, roasted chicken or dishes with red meat. Expressive of their sites and varietal character, the wines are crafted using Old World winemaking techniques, notably natural fermentation. Sustainably farmed vineyards, natural and intervention winemaking allow the terroir to shine. One 750mL bottle of Neyers Sage Canyon California Red Wine has 13.6% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: Home of the first post-Prohibition winery in Amador County, established 50 years ago, Terra d’Oro was a pioneer in helping re-establish the region’s production of fine wine. Today, Terra d’Oro is acclaimed for its elegant red wines and aromatic white wines, all crafted from our 800+ acres of sustainably farmed vineyards.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit)

description.data: Terra d’Oro Amador County Zinfandel Red Wine displays the classic characteristics unique to this region. This California red wine showcases enticing aromas of clove, cracked pepper, black cherry and violets, along with licorice and sage. An elegant entry with red fruit and a juicy midpalate leads to a finish of spice and velvety tannins. The 2017 vintage of this Terra d'Oro Zinfandel earned 90 Points from Wine Enthusiast. This dry red wine pairs beautifully with eggplant parmesan or grilled lamb skewers with a blackberry reduction. Hand-selected grapes from the prestigious Amador vineyards comprise Terra d’Oro Zinfandel, the winery’s flagship wine. These vineyards feature shallow topsoils, granite hardpan, hot summer days and cool summer nights, creating a remarkable home for the winemaker’s favorite varietal. Aged in a combination of French and American oak, this red Zinfandel wine features subtle caramel notes with indications of exotic spice. This bottled wine has 14.5% alcohol by volume. Terra d’Oro is one of Amador County’s elite producers known for critically acclaimed Zinfandels, refreshing whites and classic Italian varietals.

brandHighlight.data: Family owned and operated in the heart of Sonoma. As a family business, Hanson Organic Vodka has found their passion one might say obsession for making something truly unique that gives you the opportunity to choose something different and we’re convinced you’ll agree. Their vision of an organic, grape-based, gluten-free and non-GMO vodka is the embodiment of Hanson of Sonoma. In the spirit of artisan craft, they distill in a combination pot and 50-plate column still. Their vodka is always distilled from organic grapes and infused with real, organic ingredients to create a pure, clean, and above all deliciously smooth vodka. Hanson of Sonoma organic vodka is the first of its kind, and the product of countless hours of research, testing, and plain old hard work.

text.data: Distilled spirits like whiskey, vodka, gin, rum and tequila: Slightly cooler than room temperature, at 55-60 degrees Fahrenheit / 13-16 degrees Celsius.

description.data: Hanson of Sonoma Organic Vodka Original is a Grape-Based, Family Made Vodka crafted in the Sonoma region of California by Hanson 1st and 2nd generation family members. An award-winning vodka addition to your craft cocktail home bar, Hanson of Sonoma earned 97 Points from USA Spirits Competition in San Francisco and 96 Points from Ultimate Spirits Challenge in New York. Perfect for mixed drinks, this vodka alcohol liquor is 100% USDA Certified Organic, Non-GMO, Carb Free, Gluten Free, and Sugar Free. This Organic Vodka alcohol liquor is crafted from mostly French Colombard white grapes and distilled from a copper column still + copper pot still + copper pot still with cognac head. The result is a 100% pure distillate liquor with a hint of grape, pear, quince aromas and flavors and a smooth, pleasant mouthfeel. Enjoy Hanson of Sonoma alcoholic beverages with chocolate truffles, caviar, oysters, cheese, and charcuterie. Hanson of Sonoma Original is exceptional neat and pairs perfectly in cocktails such as Martinis, Bloody Marys, Transfusions, and other craft cocktails. One bottle of Hanson of Sonoma Original Organic Vodka Alcohol has 40% alcohol by volume, 80 proof liquor.

brandHighlight.data: The Three Thieves believe that great wine is not a pleasure reserved for kings, but rather a privilege of life – something for everyone to enjoy. So they scour the globe to find the very best wines that world has to offer, then bring it back to share at a fair and honest price. These ‘Liberators of Fine Wines’ are delighted to present their latest score: a silky-smooth Pinot Noir.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Three Thieves Pinot Noir Red Wine showcases the varietal's most beautiful qualities. Beautiful violet and fresh cherry aromas lead to raspberry and juicy cherry flavors with hints of berry jam and toasty oak on the palate. Medium bodied, this generous fruity wine has a silky texture balanced by mouthwatering acidity. This California wine has received Top 100 Best Buys by Wine Enthusiast in 2017, 2018 and 2019. This silky red wine pairs exceptionally well with rich and creamy cheese such as brie and gorgonzola, as well as lamb and pork. Approachable and enjoyable in style, this wine embodies the classic California vibe. Grapes are sourced from California, specifically Lodi and Coastal appellations. It includes small amounts of Syrah and Petite Verdot for additional structure. Gentle fermentation with French and American oak lends body to this dry red wine Pinot Noir. This bottled wine has 13.7% alcohol by volume. The Three Thieves believe that great wine is not a pleasure reserved for kings, but rather a privilege of life – something for everyone to enjoy.

brandHighlight.data:
Founded in 1994 by Don and Jennifer Hartford, the Hartford Family Winery resides in a French-style chateau in the town of Forestville, in the southwestern Russian River Valley. The winery specializes in small lots of vineyard-designated wines of high personality. The wines are labeled with two distinct marks: Hartford Court for the Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, and Hartford for old-vine Zinfandel from the Russian River Valley. In recent years, Hartford Family Winery has produced over 25 single-vineyard wines from discrete vineyard blocks from extraordinary vineyard sites extending from Sta. Rita Hills in California north to Eola-Amity Hills in Oregon.
  
Hartford Family Winery was founded in 1994 as a result of Don and Jennifer Hartford’s appreciation for the wines, the people, and the unique vineyards near their Russian River Valley home. Located in the Sonoma County town of Forestville, the winery is about 15 miles from the cool Pacific Coast.

Making delicious wines of high personality is directly related to the difficult locations of our vineyard sources, the limited production of our bottlings and the varietals we use. “Character through adversity” is an expression that we believe applies to people and grapevines and surviving adversity builds character, and personality, in both.

Hartford Family Winery specializes in making wines from single vineyard sites. In recent vintages we have made about 25 different single vineyard bottlings. Small and low-yielding vineyards deliver expressive and personality-rich wine. Our single vineyard Hartford Court Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays total as few as 93 cases, up to about 800 cases. Likewise, our Hartford Old Vine Zinfandels are produced in small quantities. Our single vineyard wines are highly allocated.

description.data: This bottled California pinot noir is 14.8% alcohol by volume.

• Alcohol Content: 14.8% ABV

brandHighlight.data: Drawing their strength and full flavours from a remarkable array of crus, enhanced by the subtle art of blending, Nicolas Feuillatte champagnes reflect the harmony, finesse and freshness of this unique region. An extensive variety of perfectly ripe grapes make up the champagnes in our range, vinified individually by cru or by area and by grape variety, together with a meticulous selection of Grands Crus and Premiers Cru. The mosaic of soils sculpt wonderfully nuanced champagnes.

description.data: Discover the epitome of Champagne craftsmanship in every bottle of Champagne Nicolas Feuillatte Terroir Premier Cru. Meticulously crafted from the esteemed soils of 26 premier cru vineyards, every drop tells a tale of elegance, timelessness, and grandeur. Delicate whispers of acacia honey, pear, and a blend of white fruits intertwine with fresh, citrusy undertones. As you take a sip, prepare for an exhilarating finale: a salty, effervescent burst that dances on the palate, exuding unparalleled poise and zest. Open a 750 ml bottle of Champagne Nicolas Feuillatte Terroir Premier Cru and pair it with fresh seafood, soft scrambled eggs, spring vegetables, or goat cheese. So go ahead and pour, sip, and celebrate — Champagne Nicolas Feuillatte Terroir Premier Cru beckons, promising moments of sheer delight.

description.data:
From the legendary Hyde Vineyard, Patz & Hall Pinot Noir Red Wine is a symphony of intricate flavors and aromas. Each sip of this California red wine teases with hints of ripe red currants, cassis, and Bing cherries. Freshness takes center stage, light and uplifting, complemented by refined tannins. Inhale, and you'll detect the Hyde Vineyard's emblematic blend of dried rose petals and a spicy duet of cardamom and cinnamon. Each bottle of Pinot Noir is 750 mL and has 14.5% ABV. Aged in 100% Burgundian French oak barrels, Patz & Hall Hyde Vineyard Pinot Noir perfectly complements pork, roast lamb, beef, and wild mushroom risotto.

Hyde Vineyard has long stood as a beacon of fine winemaking, a testament to Larry Hyde's legacy. Known as "The Wise Man of Carneros" by Wine Spectator, his influential touch in viticulture has shaped two of the state's renowned grape selections, positioning Hyde Vineyard on California's wine pedestal. Embrace the heritage, feel the finesse, and let every drop of Patz & Hall Pinot Noir recount the stories of the iconic Hyde Vineyard.

tastingNotesText.data: A robust and rich Pinot Noir red wine, providing layers of ripe red currants, cassis, and Bing cherries along with a lifted purity and freshness that supports elegant and cleansing acidity.

brandHighlight.data: The Guado al Tasso estate is located in the small but prestigious Bolgheri DOC, on the coast of upper Maremma, about 60 miles southwest from Florence.  The 2,500 acre estate stretches up from the shore of the Tyrrhenian Sea to the hills, in the heart of Bolgheri amphitheater.  This appellation has a relatively recent history, DOC Bolgheri was approved in 1995 and since then it has become an internationally recognized reference point for Italian and international winemaking arena.

description.data: Welcome a taste of Italian tradition and the enchanting landscapes of Bolgheri into your wine glass with Antinori Tenuta Guado al Tasso Il Bruciato Red Wine. At first glance, the wine's lively ruby red hue captivates, while a gentle swirl releases comforting aromas of small dark fruits, sweet spices, and a hint of tobacco, bringing a cozy Italian countryside vibe into the room. Upon sipping, the varietal trio of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Syrah from the famed Guado al Tasso estate entice your palate. The soft, ripe tannins add a comforting, velvety texture. Fresh, fruity notes dominate the finish, infusing the red wine with a lush, sweet character. Il Bruciato is a medium-bodied, easy-to-drink red wine, perfect for sharing at gatherings or enjoying a quiet evening. Pair this Italian red wine with chicken, grilled salmon, or pasta dishes with tomato sauce. So, here's to creating memories, one glass of Antinori Tenuta Guado al Tasso Il Bruciato at a time!

tastingNotesText.data: Il Bruciato showcases a ruby red hue, with aromas of dark fruit, sweet spices, and tobacco, unfolding into a well-structured palate and a lush, fruity finish.

text.data: One 750 mL bottle of Antinori Guado al Tasso Il Bruciato Red Wine, 14% ABV
Medium-bodied red wine with notes of small dark fruit, sweet spices and tobacco
Soft and ripe tannins, adding velvety texture and complexity to this red wine
This Italian red wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah from the Guado al Tasso estate in Bolgheri, Tuscany
Il Bruciato is easy-to-drink and the perfect choice for wine lovers who are new to Bolgheri wines

flavorStatement.data: Il Bruciato showcases a ruby red hue, with aromas of dark fruit, sweet spices, and tobacco, unfolding into a well-structured palate and a lush, fruity finish.

description.data: Embark on a flavorful journey with Red Diamond Malbec, a bold and vibrant red wine that epitomizes the essence of California's Malbec. In each 750 mL bottle of Red Diamond Malbec red wine, you will find a vibrant red hue accented by violet tones, a visual prelude to the aromatic adventure that awaits. Aromas of ripe berries and pomegranate greet the nose, mingled with a hint of vanilla, setting the stage for a balanced palate marked by soft tannins and a harmonious, persistent finish. Red Diamond Malbec is a blend of 80% Malbec, 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Petite Sirah, and 2% Petit Verdot, a composition that contributes to its robust flavor profile of pomegranate, vanilla, and berries. This red wine's good fruit structure and moderate to high tannins make it an excellent companion to full-flavored dishes with moderate spiciness. Pair it with tomato-based sauces, pizzas, and French dishes with hearty sauces to enhance your culinary experience.

tastingNotesText.data: A bold and vibrant Californian Malbec with a robust blend of berries, pomegranate, vanilla, soft tannins, and a harmonious, lasting finish.

text.data: One 750 mL bottle of Red Diamond Malbec red wine
A delightful journey of ripe berries and pomegranate aromas, with a touch of vanilla
Ideal companion for full-flavored, moderately spicy dishes like tomato-based sauces, pizzas, and hearty French dishes
Red wine with a good fruit structure and moderate to high tannins
Expertly blended with Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, and Petit Verdot

flavorStatement.data: A bold and vibrant Californian Malbec with a robust blend of berries, pomegranate, vanilla, soft tannins, and a harmonious, lasting finish.

brandHighlight.data: The Guado al Tasso estate is located in the small but prestigious Bolgheri DOC, on the coast of upper Maremma, about 60 miles southwest from Florence.  The 2,500 acre estate stretches up from the shore of the Tyrrhenian Sea to the hills, in the heart of Bolgheri amphitheater.  This appellation has a relatively recent history, DOC Bolgheri was approved in 1995 and since then it has become an internationally recognized reference point for Italian and international winemaking arena.

description.data: The story of Tuscany's illustrious vinicultural legacy unfolds with a bottle of Antinori Guado al Tasso Vermentino Bolgheri DOC, a medium-bodied white wine crafted from 100% Vermentino grapes harvested from the poetic landscape of Bolgheri. As you uncork the bottle, an inviting bouquet of aromas greets you, featuring zestful citrus, tender white flower blossoms, and a hint of tropical fruit. Bolgheri, a land kissed by a unique microclimate thanks to its orientation and loving embrace from the neighboring sea, imparts to this wine its signature freshness and pronounced mineral notes. As this Italian white wine cascades across your palate, the dance of citrus aromas, citron peel, and elderflowers unfurl in a lively ballet. With 13% ABV, Antinori Guado al Tasso Vermentino Bolgheri pairs with seafood fare, a garden-fresh vegetable medley, or grilled eggplant. So, pour a glass of white wine and let Antinori Guado al Tasso Vermentino Bolgheri transport you to Italy's prestigious Tuscan coast.

tastingNotesText.data: With a nose revealing zestful citrus, tender white flower, and tropical fruit notes, this Italian white wine reveals Bolgheri's distinctive freshness and mineral grace on the palate.

text.data: One 750 mL bottle of Antinori Guado al Tasso Vermentino Bolgheri DOC, White Wine, 13% ABV
Medium bodied white wine with aromas of  citrus fruit, white flower blossoms and tropical fruit
Pair a glass of this Italian white wine with grilled eggplant and zucchini with balsamic marinade, chicken tenders, flounder with lemon butter
Made from 100% Vermentino grapes from the Bolgheri region of Tuscany, Italy
White wine with fresh acidity and balance of mineral and salinity

flavorStatement.data: With a nose revealing zestful citrus, tender white flower, and tropical fruit notes, this Italian white wine reveals Bolgheri's distinctive freshness and mineral grace on the palate.

brandHighlight.data:
Hyde Vineyard has justifiably become one of the superstar vineyards in Carneros. Through many years
of dedicated research, planting and winemaking, Larry Hyde has developed two of the most important
grape selections in California: Hyde-Wente Chardonnay and Hyde-Calera Pinot Noir. Both are noted
for extremely low yields, primarily due to the very small berry size within each cluster. The Chardonnay
from Hyde is some of the most sought-after fruit in the pantheon of great California vineyards

description.data:
Uncover a world of nuanced flavors in the Patz & Hall Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay, the heart of Napa Valley in a bottle. Each sip evokes the quintessential charm of Hyde Vineyard, with whispers of white flowers, sun-ripened summer melon, vibrant tangerine zest, and the allure of spicy poached pear. On the palate, the Chardonnay unveils citrus oils, toasted almond cookies, cedar's nuance, and a touch of anise. Made from 100% Chardonnay fruit, its vibrant freshness is balanced by deep richness, echoing the finest Chardonnays from around the world. Matured in 100% Burgundian French oak barrels, this Chardonnay white wine is aged 16 months on primary lees, ensuring depth and complexity before its journey to the bottle.
 
For over thirty years, Patz & Hall has been synonymous with the quest to identify and collaborate with the most remarkable small, family-owned Chardonnay and Pinot Noir vineyards in California. Our mission? To create wines that truly reflect the singular charm and character of these exceptional vineyards.

tastingNotesText.data: An elegant, powerful and full Chardonnay white wine, Patz & Hall Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay balances vibrant tangerine zest with spicy pear and a nuanced cedar finish.

text.data: One 750 mL bottle of Patz & Hall Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay White Wine
100% Chardonnay fruit with 14.5% ABV from Carneros in Napa Valley
An elegant, powerful and full of classic Hyde Vineyard traits of delicate flower white, summer melon, tangerine zest and pear
On the palate the wine offers citrus oils, toasted almond cookies, cedar and anise
100% Burgundian French oak barrels and aged for 16 months on primary lees before bottling
Pair Patz & Hall Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay with lobster, grilled fish, or a fruit tart

flavorStatement.data: An elegant, powerful and full Chardonnay white wine, Patz & Hall Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay balances vibrant tangerine zest with spicy pear and a nuanced cedar finish.

brandHighlight.data:
Introduced with the 1985 vintage, Pèppoli Chianti Classico DOCG
is the archetypal modern Chianti Classico. Pèppoli combines the
complexity and structure of a well-aged Riserva with the fruity fragrance
of a young \ wine. This style is made possible by a unique microclimate where east-northeast
facing vineyards are planted in a small heat-retaining valley on mineral
rich, rocky soils that are perfect for growing very fruity, lively Sangiovese.

description.data: Journey through the essence of Italy with the vivacious character of Antinori Pèppoli Chianti Classico DOCG Red Wine caressing your senses. This inviting red wine presents itself in a charming ruby red shade, with intense notes of ripe cherries and sweet strawberries, balanced by delicate floral notes of rose. Delicate hints of spices, aromatic herbs and notes of light toasting complete its bouquet. On the palate it’s vibrant, fresh with supple tannins and a finish that brings back aromatic notes perceived on the nose. Pèppoli perfectly pairs with grilled lamb chops, roasted chicken, spaghetti and meatballs, or even a casual pizza night.

tastingNotesText.data: Antinori Pèppoli Chianti Classico DOCG enchants with ripe cherries, sweet strawberries, soft spices, and a fresh, supple finish.

text.data: One 750 mL bottle of Antinori Pèppoli Chianti Classico DOCG Red Wine, 13.5% ABV
Pèppoli offers intense notes of cherries and strawberries that are well balanced with floral undertones of rose
Pair Antinori Pèppoli Chianti Classico with grilled lamb chops, roasted chicken, spaghetti and meatballs or pizza
On the palate this red wine is vibrant and  fresh with supple tannins
This Italian red wine is primarily Sangiovese grapes with a small percentage of Merlot and Syrah grown on the Pèppoli estate

flavorStatement.data: Antinori Pèppoli Chianti Classico DOCG enchants with ripe cherries, sweet strawberries, soft spices, and a fresh, supple finish.

brandHighlight.data: The Chenoweth family established their homestead estate in Green Valley in the mid-1800s. Increasingly well known as one of California’s preeminent vineyard managers, Charlie Chenoweth has earned recognition for his talent as a farmer, and for his collaborative approach to viticulture. In this spirit, we were pleased to work alongside Charlie during the planting of Chenoweth Ranch. We first designated this site as a single-vineyard bottling in 2004. Charlie has also been able to bring us some superlative Pinot Noir fruit over the years for our Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir blend from his Sonoma County vineyard developments.

description.data:
From the heart of the Russian River Valley emerges Patz & Hall Chenoweth Ranch Pinot Noir, a red wine that instantly captivates. With each swirl and sip, generous aromas of cinnamon, five spice powder, dried cranberry, licorice, and the evocative scent of a damp forest floor enchant the senses. Further layers of dark chocolate, fresh lavender, and cedar introduce a palate characterized by its supple, rich tannins, combining depth with finesse. Although primed for immediate enjoyment, this red wine's intrinsic charm and balance suggest an equally promising evolution with patient cellaring. Each bottle is 750 mL and has 14.5% ABV. Patz & Hall Pinot Noir from Chenoweth Ranch stands as a testament to the unparalleled beauty and complexity of Sonoma County's Russian River Valley.

For over thirty years, Patz & Hall has been synonymous with the quest to identify and collaborate with the most remarkable small, family-owned Chardonnay and Pinot Noir vineyards in California. Our mission? To create wines that truly reflect the singular charm and character of these exceptional vineyards.

tastingNotesText.data: A Pinot Noir red wine from Chenoweth Ranch, with generous aromas of cinnamon, five spice powder, dried cranberry and licorice.

text.data: One 750 mL bottle of Patz & Hall Chenoweth Ranch Pinot Noir Red Wine
This Pinot Noir offers generous aromas of cinnamon, five spice powder, dried cranberry and licorice
A medium full-bodied red wine with 14.5% alcohol by volume
Well-balanced red wine with refreshing acidity and rich tannins
Grapes sourced from Chenoweth Ranch, Russian River Valley in Sonoma County, California
Drink it today, or cellar it for another day

flavorStatement.data: A Pinot Noir red wine from Chenoweth Ranch, with generous aromas of cinnamon, five spice powder, dried cranberry and licorice.
