brandHighlight.data:
The original Super Tuscan, Tignanello, is produced exclusively from a 140-acre
vineyard site at Antinori’s Tignanello Estate. The vineyards are southwest facing, with calcareous rocky-marl and limestone
soils with tufaceous elements, locally called alberese rocks. They are planted
between 1,150 and 1,312 feet above sea level. It was the first Sangiovese wine to be aged in small oak barrels, the first modern red wine to use such non-traditional varieties as Cabernet in the blend, and among the first red wines from the Chianti Classico area to be produced without white grapes.  Since the 1982 vintage, the vineyard and wine blend has been 80% Sangiovese, 15% Cabernet Sauvginon and 5% Cabernet Franc.

description.data: Discover Antinori Tenuta Tignanello Toscana IGT Red Wine, the original Super Tuscan, embodying the rich essence of its illustrious Italian vineyard origins. Originating from a cherished 140-acre plot in Antinori's Tignanello Estate, this wine symbolizes vinous innovation since its celebrated 1982 vintage. This Italian red wine is meticulously crafted with 70% Sangiovese, 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, and 5% Cabernet Franc, each adding to its majestic profile. Initial red fruit, strawberry, and pomegranate notes gradually reveal tender apricot, peach, and delicate vanilla aromas. Subtle hints of dried flowers, chocolate, nutmeg spice, alongside whimsical coffee, caramel, and Mediterranean herb notes create a captivating aromatic experience. On tasting, Tignanello unveils a resplendent character with silky, vibrant tannins. A perfect accompaniment to hearty beef, pasta dishes, cold cuts, or medium-aged cheeses. Awarded 96 Points and ranked #5 in Wine Spectator's Top 100 Wines 2022, Antinori Tenuta Tignanello is a testament to unparalleled craftsmanship and tradition.

tastingNotesText.data: As the original Super Tuscan, Antinori Tenuta Tignanello enchants with a velvety dance of vibrant tannins, unveiling a playful spice and red fruit tapestry with each sip.

text.data: One 750 mL bottle of Antinori Tenuta Tignanello Toscana IGT red wine
Tignanello is produced exclusively from the estate vineyard of the same name in Italy from the Toscana IGT origin
A perfect red wine blend with 80% Sangiovese mixed with Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc
The wine offers a graceful and mouth filling palate that presents silky, vibrant tannins and imparts liveliness with a lengthy flavor profile
The 2019 vintage received 96 Points, #5- Top 100 Wines 2022, Hot Wines & Collectibles from the Wine Spectator (07/12/22)
Enjoy a glass of Antinori's Tenuta Tignanello wine with beef, hearty pasta dishes, cold cuts and medium-aged cheeses

flavorStatement.data: As the original Super Tuscan, Antinori Tenuta Tignanello enchants with a velvety dance of vibrant tannins, unveiling a playful spice and red fruit tapestry with each sip.

description.data:
From the captivating terrains of the Sonoma Coast comes the Patz & Hall Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir Red Wine. With an orchestra of black cherry, dried cranberry, cinnamon, and dark cocoa aromas, this Pinot Noir captures the essence of the mysterious porcini mushroom-forest floor. Each sip delivers a broad and generous mouthfeel, layered with rich plum and cassis, making this red wine a testament to the nuanced beauty of the Sonoma Coast in California. Ideal for pairing with seafood, poultry, and delicate red meats, this Pinot Noir stands confidently on its own as well. Relish in its age-worthy potential, as the Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir promises to flourish and evolve with time. Dive into a 750 mL bottle of wine and let the story of this Sonoma Coast gem unfold in your glass.

For over thirty years, Patz & Hall has been synonymous with the quest to identify and collaborate with the most remarkable small, family-owned Chardonnay and Pinot Noir vineyards in California. Our mission? To create wines that truly reflect the singular charm and character of these exceptional vineyards.

tastingNotesText.data: Intense, complex aromas of black cherry, dried cranberry, cinnamon, and dark cocoa along with hints of porcini mushroom-forest floor that intermingle and intertwine into an elusive and beguiling symphony of aromas.

text.data: One 750 mL bottle of Patz & Hall Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir Red WIne
Elegant and complex red wine with aromas of black cherry, dried cranberry, cinnamon, and dark cocoa
Pair Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir with seafood, poultry, and light red meat dishes, or own its own
Well-balanced red wine with refreshing acidity and a long, lingering finish
Pinot Noir from the Sonoma Coast in California
Age-worthy California red wine that will evolve with time

flavorStatement.data: Intense, complex aromas of black cherry, dried cranberry, cinnamon, and dark cocoa along with hints of porcini mushroom-forest floor that intermingle and intertwine into an elusive and beguiling symphony of aromas.

brandHighlight.data:
Guado al Tasso, meaning literally “Badger’s Ford,” takes its name from the common
sight of badgers at the estate where this wine is produced. The estate is located approximately 80 miles southwest of Florence, near the medieval
town of Bolgheri.

description.data: A gem of Italian winemaking, the Antinori Tenuta Guado al Tasso Bolgheri Superiore DOC Red Wine opens a portal to the revered terroirs of Bolgheri with every pour. Painting your glass an intense ruby red, this red wine offers a captivating trail of aromas led by sweet spices, dark ripe fruits, licorice root, and tobacco. A distinguished blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Cabernet Franc grapes, Antinori Tenuta Guado al Tasso offers a gentle warmth, like the comforting embrace of the Tuscan sun. The tannins glide effortlessly, starting with a silky overture that crescendos into a vibrant, vivacious finale. The structure and body of Antinori Tenuta Guado al Tasso stand up against the richness of hearty meals, like roast duck, and embraces the mature character of aged cheeses. Explore the timeless and treasured essence of Italian viniculture today, or let it mature gracefully.

tastingNotesText.data: Reveling an intense ruby red, Antinori Guado al Tasso entices with sweet spices, dark ripe fruit aromas, leading to silky tannins on the palate, and a vibrant, balanced finish.

brandHighlight.data: In 1967, Warren Dutton planted some of the first Chardonnay vines in western Sonoma.  Sons Steve and Joe Dutton, along with their mother Gail, carry on in Warren's footsteps with what is now one of Sonoma County's most successful vineyard operations.  We are able to select from blocks of Chardonnay largely planted with California heirloom clones (Robert Young, Rued. Hvde-Wente and UC Davis Clone 4) for the Dutton Ranch Chardonnay bottling.

description.data:
Venture into the heart of Russian River Valley with Patz & Hall Dutton Ranch Chardonnay White Wine. Unveiling layers of toasted almond, butter cookie, and nutmeg, this California white wine entices your senses with a vibrant array of Meyer lemon, passionfruit, and orange blossom notes. Its sumptuous mid-palate elegantly transitions to a mineral-rich finish. Celebrate the allure of Sonoma County's cherished Chardonnay vines with this 750 mL bottle of white wine, with 14.5% ABV. Perfectly suited for grilled fish, chicken, or shellfish, it's a testament to the timeless appeal and depth of Sonoma's legendary Chardonnay vines. 

For over thirty years, Patz & Hall has been synonymous with the quest to identify and collaborate with the most remarkable small, family-owned Chardonnay and Pinot Noir vineyards in California. Our mission? To create wines that truly reflect the singular charm and character of these exceptional vineyards.

tastingNotesText.data: Patz & Hall Dutton Ranch Chardonnay entices with notes of toasted almond, Meyer lemon, and orange blossom, capturing Sonoma's timeless Chardonnay charm in a mineral-rich finish.

brandHighlight.data: Drawing their strength and full flavours from a remarkable array of crus, enhanced by the subtle art of blending, Nicolas Feuillatte champagnes reflect the harmony, finesse and freshness of this unique region. An extensive variety of perfectly ripe grapes make up the champagnes in our range, vinified individually by cru or by area and by grape variety, together with a meticulous selection of Grands Crus and Premiers Cru. The mosaic of soils sculpt wonderfully nuanced champagnes.

description.data: Champagne Nicolas Feuillatte Réserve Exclusive Rosé is a delicately nuanced Champagne bursting with red fruit flavors. Bathed in a radiant salmon pink hue kissed by silvery glimmers, this champagne unveils an endless stream of delicate bubbles. Our Réserve Exclusive Rosé tantalizes the senses with aromatic notes of red currant, blueberry, raspberry, and a subtle touch of strawberry. This medium-bodied Rosé Champagne, with a 12% alcohol content, harmonizes beautifully with delicacies like tuna carpaccio or salmon sashimi. Hailing from Chouilly, France, this glorious blend of Pinot Noir, Meunier, and Chardonnay grapes encapsulates the pure essence of rosé champagne. Experience the brilliant fusion of red fruit aromas with Champagne Nicolas Feuillatte Réserve Exclusive Rosé in a 750 mL bottle.

tastingNotesText.data: Radiant salmon pink with delicate bubbles, this Rosé Champagne enchants with notes of red currant, blueberry, raspberry, and a whisper of strawberry.

brandHighlight.data: SEAGLASS wines - crafted by winemaker and California native Christine Morrison for more than a decade - are the ultimate expression of California's Central coast. Aromatic and refreshing, they encapsulate the signature acidity of cool-climate winemaking, embodying the influence of the ocean. SEAGLASS wines are all Certified Sustainable, and we care deeply about protecting the land and the sea and ensuring our beaches are accesible to all people, which is why we are a proud sponsor of the Surfrider Foundation. SEAGLASS Wine Company gets it name from the bits of glass that are polished over decades into beautiful, one-of-a-kind gems by the natural ebb and flow of wind, sea and fog. We hope you enjoy drinking our wine as much as we enjoy making it.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: SEAGLASS Rosé Wine belongs on everyone's table. Crafted entirely from free-run juice, with no pressed grapes, this soft, light-bodied, dry wine showcases lovely aromas and a pale pink hue. A beautiful reflection of wine making on Monterey County’s pristine coastal terroir, this blush wine opens with fragrant wild strawberries and dried rose petals on the nose. Flavors of juicy cherry and ripe raspberry are balanced by refreshing acidity and a crisp finish. The 2020 vintage was awarded 90 points by the Tasting Panel in the July/August 2021 issue. This vibrant pink wine is a diverse menu partner, pairing exceptionally well with prosciutto and melon or crab cakes with spicy aioli. Sourced from California's renowned Monterey County, this blush wine is fermented at cold temperatures in stainless steel tanks, with no malolactic fermentation. This bottled wine is 13.4% alcohol by volume and comes in a screwcap bottle for easy opening without a corkscrew. SEAGLASS wines offer a rewarding discovery of high quality, fresh, bright flavorful wines with a casual yet sophisticated take on California’s Central Coast wine growing region.

brandHighlight.data: SEAGLASS wines - crafted by winemaker and California native Christine Morrison for more than a decade - are the ultimate expression of California's Central coast. Aromatic and refreshing, they encapsulate the signature acidity of cool-climate winemaking, embodying the influence of the ocean. description.data: SEAGLASS Riesling White Wine showcases a blend of ripe apricot, sweet peach, tropical fruit and floral aromas. White flowers on the palate are supported by flavors of juicy apricot, peach and melon, with hints of honeysuckle. A balanced acidity leads to a lingering finish with a touch of sweet. The 2019 vintage was awarded 93 points and "Best Riesling" in 2020 by the American Wine Society. A semi sweet wine that can easily be enjoyed on its own or with a variety of dishes, SEAGLASS Riesling pairs well with spicy Asian dishes, smoked salmon, lobster salad and blue cheese. The cool-climate vineyards of Monterey and Santa Barbara counties give this Riesling plenty of time to develop its signature aromatics. The naturally fresh fruit flavor of the Riesling white wine grape is retained by carefully avoiding any oxygen exposure during wine making. Cold fermentation in stainless steel tanks allows the delicate varietal flavors to reach their ultimate expression. This bottled wine is 12.5% alcohol by volume and comes in a screwcap bottle for easy opening without a corkscrew. SEAGLASS Wine Company produces one-of-a-kind coastal wines. SEAGLASS wines encapsulate the ocean air, the sandy coastline and the fresh acidity of cool-climate fruit along the California Central Coast and are crafted from wind-swept vines that deliver nuanced flavors in the cellar and complex notes in the glass. SEAGLASS offers a rewarding discovery of high quality, fresh, bright flavorful wines with a casual yet sophisticated take on California’s Central Coast wine growing region.

Intense, expressive notes of exotic fruit, pineapple and grapefruit on the nose mingle with flinty aromas. Simultaneously fruity, supple and concentrated, Coeur de Charmes has good weight and a refreshing, minerally finish.

brandHighlight.data: Tres Agaves Tequila is 100% de Agave, USDA Certified Organic made in Amatitán, Tequila Valley, Mexico, the historic birthplace of Tequila. Its Blue Weber Agave is grown and harvested by a single source, then fermented and distilled using traditional methods. Tres Agaves Organic Blanco is unaged while Tres Agaves Organic Reposado is aged 9 months in former Tennessee Whiskey and Kentucky Bourbon barrels and Tres Agaves Organic Anejo is aged 18 months exclusively in Kentucky Bourbon barrels. Tres Agaves Organic Tequilas are perfect for sipping or mixing into classic cocktails. Tres Agaves Cocktail Mixers are USDA Certified Organic, low calorie, low glycemic index, and naturally delicious. They contain simple, easy to pronounce ingredients and contain no high fructose corn syrup (HFCS). Simply add Tres Agaves Tequila or your favorite premium Vodka or Rum. Tres Agaves Cocktail Mixers are highly awarded and one of the fastest growing mixer brands in the US.

text.data: Distilled spirits like whiskey, vodka, gin, rum and tequila: Slightly cooler than room temperature, at 55-60 degrees Fahrenheit / 13-16 degrees Celsius.

description.data: Tres Agaves Organic Agave Nectar is a cocktail-ready sweetener sourced from the same blue agave plants as Tres Agaves Tequila, making it an essential margarita ingredient. This ridiculously delicious, low calorie sweetener is a Beverage Tasting Institute Gold winner. Unlike other honey-like agave syrup sweeteners, this USDA Certified organic sweetener is balanced with just enough purified water so that it dissolves easily in cold beverages, like iced tea, margaritas or other cocktails. Agave nectar is also a great way to sweeten hot items like coffee, tea or even oatmeal. If you're out of margarita mix, simply combine this agave sweetener with tequila and lime juice for a fresh margarita in minutes. Sourced from Mexico's Tequila Valley, blue agave takes six to eight years to mature. After harvest, the agave is slow roasted to convert the starches to caramelizing sugars. Tres Agaves Organic Agave sweetener does not contain alcohol. In Tequila Valley, we trust.

description.data: Tres Agaves Organic Lime Margarita Mix makes it easy to create real, organic margaritas at home. This USDA Certified Organic, gluten free, low calorie, low glycemic index mix is made with just four simple ingredients: organic agave nectar, organic lime juice, pure filtered water, and Vitamin C. With 68 calories per serving, this margarita mix creates a natural, lower calorie and great tasting margarita that's free from high fructose corn syrup. With just the right balance of sweet and sour, this organic margarita mix perfectly complements the unique flavor profile of Tres Agaves Tequila. Tres Agaves Organic Lime Margarita Mix won Gold in the Beverage Tasting Institute’s 90-point Award for Excellence. Simply shake this margarita mix with Tres Agaves Organic 100% de Agave Tequila and serve in your favorite rocks glass. This bottle of margarita mixer does not contain alcohol. Refrigerate the bottle after opening. In Tequila Valley, we trust.

text.data: Distilled spirits like whiskey, vodka, gin, rum and tequila: Slightly cooler than room temperature, at 55-60 degrees Fahrenheit / 13-16 degrees Celsius.

description.data: Tres Agaves Organic Strawberry Daiquiri and Margarita Mix makes it easy to create real, healthier, organic margaritas and daiquiris at home. This USDA Certified Organic, gluten free, low calorie, low glycemic index mixer is made with simple, all-natural ingredients, including organic strawberry puree, organic agave nectar, organic lime juice, pure filtered water and Vitamin C. With 68 calories per serving, this cocktail mixer creates a natural, great tasting margarita that's free from high fructose corn syrup. The simple ingredients in Tres Agaves margarita mixers complement tequila’s unique taste profile while delivering a soothing, soul-replenishing taste of summer. An award-winning addition to your cocktail mixers, Tres Agaves Strawberry Daiquiri and Margarita Mix won Gold at the Los Angeles International Competition. Simply shake this margarita mix with Tres Agaves Organic 100% de Agave Tequila and ice, and serve in your favorite rocks glass. This bottle of margarita mixer does not contain alcohol. Refrigerate the bottle after opening.

description.data: Northstar, located in Walla Walla, Washington, using fruit sourced from one of the world's best regions for the variety: Washington state. Winemaker, David "Merf" Merfeld, blends New World fruit with an old world winemaking style. 100% Cabernet offers classic black fruits (currants, plums), graphite and licorice aromatics, medium to full bodied, a rounded, nicely concentrated palate and a great finish. It's a classic Columbia Valley Cabernet to enjoy anytime over the coming decade or more.

tastingNotesText.data: Aromas of dark fruit lead into a palate ripe with blackberry, black raspberry, cassis, raspberry, cherry, and vanilla flavors.

brandHighlight.data: Antica is an Antinori Family estate in the Napa Valley. The family’s winemaking heritage dates back 26 generations and over 630 years in Italy. ‘Antica’ represents Antinori California, and fulfills the family’s long-standing desire to produce beautiful wines in Napa Valley.

description.data: This Antica Cabernet Sauvignon brims with aromas of dark currant, blackberry and black cherry fruit. The wine is generous in its flavors while offering refinement and elegance, with smooth, velvety tannins. The finish is very expressive and long, with the concentrated fruit and sweet tannins steadily emerging to win out in the end. To maintain ultimate control of wine quality and style, the Antinori family’s guiding winemaking principle has been to own their own vineyards and grow their own grapes. This belief holds true with the historic family-owned vineyards in Tuscany and Umbria and extends to Napa Valley.

tastingNotesText.data: A pure, rich and full-bodied Cabernet Sauvignon with powerful flavors of currant, blackberry, black licorice and spice

brandHighlight.data: Santa Cristina, a new chapter in the long tradition of wine making. High on a Tuscan hillside sits the historic town of Cortona.  A vast plain extends on one side and on the other, the hill and village.  This is the captivating panorama surrounding the Santa Cristina winery, established in 2006 to strengthen and renew the tradition of crafting its eponymous wine, over 70 years after its first vintage.  Over time, Santa Cristina has become a reference point for winemaking experts as well as wine enthusiasts due to our commitment to achieving quality.

description.data: More than 60 years ago, Antinori introduced a Sangiovese-based red wine called Santa Cristina, a timeless classic made from Italy’s most famous red varietal. Based on the desire to produce a white wine as well-regarded by wine lovers as their red wine, Santa Cristina introduced Pinot Grigio with the 2006 vintage. This beauty is made from Italy’s most popular white varietal and is extremely versatile and full of character. This wine's origin, the delle Venezie DOC region, is renowned for growing world-class Pinot Grigio. The nose offers delicate aromas and flavors of ripe apples, white flower blossoms and citrus fruit. On the palate, it is soft and pleasing with a refreshing finish. The perfect wine for every occasion, an Italian classic every time!

tastingNotesText.data: A refreshing Pinot Grigio that offers delicate aromas and flavors of ripe apple, white flower blossoms and citrus fruit. It is well-balanced with a refreshing finish.

text.data: One 750 ml bottle of Santa Cristina Pinot Grigio delle Venezie DOC white wine
A new convenient easy-to-open screw top, no wine opener is needed
Crisp refreshing white wine that presents aromas of ripe apples, white flower blossoms and citrus fruits
100% Pinot Grigio grown in the delle Venezie DOC region in Italy
Aged briefly in stainless steel tanks to preserve the wine's fresh fruit flavors
Enjoy a glass of Santa Cristina Pinot Grigio with summery salads, grilled chicken and light pasta dishes
Versatile, food-friendly wine that displays all the characteristics of Italy's most popular white varietal

flavorStatement.data: A refreshing Pinot Grigio that offers delicate aromas and flavors of ripe apple, white flower blossoms and citrus fruit. It is well-balanced with a refreshing finish.

description.data:
Rooted in the Walla Walla Valley of Washington State, Spring Valley Vineyard Nina Lee Syrah Red Wine encapsulates the essence of elegance and refinement. Named after the beloved Nina Lee, wife of Frederick Corkrum, this Syrah red wine is a true masterpiece, filling the air with an enchanting aromatic maze of dry wheat and delicate hints of violet and bursts of bright cherry flavors. Sourced primarily from the revered blocks of the 1998 original vineyard and the scenic "Steep Hill" Vineyard, this Syrah red wine echoes the robust spirit of its origin in every sip. With 13.8% ABV, this medium to full-bodied Syrah red wine is the perfect companion for kobe-style beef ribs or an exquisite duck confit. Delight in it today, or let our Nina Lee Syrah sleep in your cellar, maturing into an even richer version of itself. 

Spring Valley Vineyard has a profound respect for its heritage and the land it thrives upon. The family's unwavering dedication to farming the same soil for six generations inspired the names bestowed upon our wines. With each bottle of our limited-production, estate-grown red wine, you become part of their story, savoring the fruits of their labor and embracing the rich tapestry of their legacy.

tastingNotesText.data: Named after the beloved Nina Lee, wife of Frederick Corkrum, this Syrah red wine enchants your senses with an aromatic maze of dry wheat, delicate violet hints, and bursts of bright cherry flavors, complemented by its strong structure and complex minerality.

text.data: One 750 ml bottle of Spring Valley Vineyard Nina Lee Syrah Red Wine
Aromas of dry wheat and hints of violet, followed with bright cherry flavors and a pepper finish
Open a bottle of Nina Lee Syrah to go with kobe-style beef ribs, or duck confit
Medium to full-bodied, seamless and beautifully textured
Estate-grown from the Walla Walla Valley in Washington State
Syrah red wine with 13.8% alcohol by volume
Drink it today, or cellar it for another day

flavorStatement.data: Named after the beloved Nina Lee, wife of Frederick Corkrum, this Syrah red wine enchants your senses with an aromatic maze of dry wheat, delicate violet hints, and bursts of bright cherry flavors, complemented by its strong structure and complex minerality.

brandHighlight.data: Erath wines are an expression of the land that the winery has cultivated for more than 40 years, longer than any other winery in the Dundee Hills of Oregon. The red, iron-rich Jory soils, combined with gentle breezes and warming sunshine of a marine climate, have bestowed upon Dundee a terroir of note. It has given rise to the handcrafting phenomenon, and the art of Pinot.

description.data:
Erath Resplendent Pinot Noir is a beautifully crafted red wine that embodies the true essence of Oregon's terroir. This Pinot Noir is distinctly rich and offers sumptuous tones of dark berry flavors, which are perfectly balanced with spicy wood notes. The wine is carefully crafted using a curated blend of French Oak during maturation, which complements the fruit and provides a delicate layer of inviting oak flavors. Our Resplendent Pinot Noir red wine has a structured yet soft palate that makes it a crowd-pleaser, whether enjoyed alone or with food. The wine's ripe, round, and approachable character makes it an excellent choice for those who enjoy a more sophisticated wine drinking experience. Enjoy a glass of this Oregon red wine with roast chicken, smoked roast turkey, onion pie. Wine bottles are 750 ml and have 13.5% ABV.

Erath wines are an expression of the land that the winery has cultivated for more than 40 years, longer than any other winery in the Dundee Hills of Oregon. The unique red, iron-rich Jory soils, combined with gentle breezes and warming sunshine of a marine climate, have created the perfect terroir for handcrafted wines and the art of Pinot.

tastingNotesText.data: A sophisticated and crowd-pleasing red wine, Erath Resplendent Pinot Noir captures the essence of Oregon's terroir with sumptuous dark berry flavors, balanced spicy wood notes, and a delicate layer of inviting oak flavors.

Erath Resplendent Pinot Noir wine is made from fruit sourced in Willamette Valley of Oregon

flavorStatement.data: A sophisticated and crowd-pleasing red wine, Erath Resplendent Pinot Noir captures the essence of Oregon's terroir with sumptuous dark berry flavors, balanced spicy wood notes, and a delicate layer of inviting oak flavors.

description.data:
Discover the allure of the Eola-Amity Hills Appellation with Erath Willakia Estate Pinot Noir. Grown in one of the most renowned growing regions within the greater Willamette Valley, this sustainably farmed red wine offers sweet bramble and cranberry notes with complex indulgent aromas of anise, cedar, and dried botanicals. The flavors are focused across the palate with gentle, soft tannins, reflecting the winemaker's attention to detail and early-season Burgundian style picking decisions. Sip on the Erath Willakia Estate Pinot Noir red wine and experience the essence of the Oregon wine country in every glass.

Erath wines are an expression of the land that the winery has cultivated for more than 40 years, longer than any other winery in the Dundee Hills of Oregon. The unique red, iron-rich Jory soils, combined with gentle breezes and warming sunshine of a marine climate, have created the perfect terroir for handcrafted wines and the art of Pinot.

brandHighlight.data: Tormaresca was founded in 1998 with the investment and vision of the Antinori family in Italy’s Puglia region in Southern Italy. The heel of the boot! The name Calafuria was inspired by the many bays and inlets on the coast of Puglia. It translates to “bay fury.”

description.data: Calafuria is pale pink in color. One the nose, Calafuria offers fruity notes of grapefruit, orange blossoms, jasmine and lime.  The palate is pleasantly fresh with excellent aromatic persistence offering a delicate savory note on the finish. We adore the label of the sea side coves surrounding the tower town of Tormaresca. This will be your NEW favorite rose!! Great on it's own or with a wide variety of foods. Tormaresca was founded in 1998 with the investment and vision of the Antinori family in Italy’s Puglia region in Southern Italy. The heel of the boot!

tastingNotesText.data: Calafuria is a delicate pale pink color that reveals fresh fruit and citrus aromas of pink grapefruit, orange blossoms, jasmine and lime. The palate is pleasantly fresh with a delicate savory note on the finish.

brandHighlight.data: The FAY vineyard is where the Stag’s Leap Wine Cellars story began. Established by pioneering grape grower Nathan Fay in 1961, it was the first planting of Cabernet Sauvignon in what is now the Stags Leap District. At the time, conventional wisdom maintained that the area was too cool for Cabernet Sauvignon. But tasting Nathan Fay’s homemade Cabernet in 1969 was a defining moment for the founder of Stag’s Leap Wine Cellars. Here was land capable of producing a wine that could rival the best in the world. Within a year an adjoining ranch, now known as S.L.V., was purchased. And, in 1986, the winery purchased Nathan Fay’s vineyard and named it FAY in his honor. The first vintage of a single vineyard FAY Cabernet Sauvignon was 1990.

description.data: The Stag's Leap Wine Cellars FAY Cabernet Sauvignon delivers fragrant aromas of ripe raspberry and boysenberry along with hints of jasmine, gardenia and nutmeg. This red wine has a lively mouthfeel with polished tannins, a juicy mid-palate and a silky finish bursting with red fruits and berries. Try pairing this estate-grown Cabernet Sauvignon with Baby Back Ribs with Saba Glaze, Maple Soy Glazed Salon or Eggplant Parmesan.  FAY vineyard remains one of the great Napa Valley vineyards, producing fruit with an abundance of supple red and black berry character, voluptuous perfume and a luscious, fine-grained texture. The grapes were primarily sourced from Blocks 2C, 3A, 8AB, 3B, 2A, 6 and 2B, which combined, give the wine its classic red-fruit tones and aromatic top notes as well as its structure. When the various lots are blended and aged in French oak barrels, the resulting wine gives us the classic expression that is a hallmark of our estate-grown Cabernet Sauvignon, “an iron fist in a velvet glove.”

tastingNotesText.data: FAY Cabernet Sauvignon delivers fragrant aromas of ripe raspberry and boysenberry along with hints of jasmine, gardenia and nutmeg.

description.data:
Almost black with reddish hues. The nose is complex and intense with nuances of violet, blueberry, orange peel, and spice. A fresh and vibrant wine with a soft mouthfeel, its lush finish lingers with notes of blueberry, black plum, and hints of pepper and star anise.

The term "Fervent" is defined as "having intensity of spirit, feeling and enthusiasm," an apt description of winemaker Michel Gassier's passion for Syrah. Le Fervent is produced in Costières de Nîmes, the southern-most appellation of the Rhone Valley nestled on the shores of the Mediterranean, and is sourced from some of the coolest vineyard sites of the Southern Rhone, thanks to the strong maritime influence.

tastingNotesText.data: Almost black with reddish hues. The nose is both complex and intense, of black plum, China ink, blood orange and hints of pencil lead. A very fresh and vibrant wine with flavors of blueberry, boysenberry liquor and garrigue, underlined by hints of toast and cocoa. It is framed by refined tannins and good acidity.

brandHighlight.data: Hands of Time wines pay tribute to the many hands involved in the art of winemaking, from grower to cellar to bottle. This passion project is led  by skilled veteran winemakers and demonstrates their commitment to crafting the best wines possible in tandem with their expert cellar crews and long-time vineyard partners. Every time you’re handed a glass at your favorite restaurant or wine bar, you’re joining the celebration of the skilled hands in the legendary Napa Valley and Sonoma County.

brandHighlight.data: While Stag’s Leap Wine Cellars began making Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc in the early 1980s, 2013 was the first vintage of AVETA, named for a water goddess often depicted carrying fruit. It is a fitting moniker to express the vibrant fruit flavors and minerality of our Sauvignon Blanc which is crafted from fruit grown in the alluvial soils of our estate vineyards as well as other exceptional Napa Valley sites.

description.data: The Stag's Leap Wine Cellars AVETA Sauvignon Blanc white wine offers fragrant aromas of lemongrass, passion fruit, papaya and tangerine. The wine has bright and fresh acidity with a flavorful finish filled with lingering guava, citrus and honeysuckle notes. Try pairing AVETA Sauvignon Blanc with fresh fish ceviche, crab cakes or grilled oysters with mignonette sauce.

tastingNotesText.data: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars AVETA Sauvignon Blanc offers fragrant aromas of lemongrass, passion fruit, papaya and tangerine.

brandHighlight.data: Antica is an Antinori Family estate in the Napa Valley. The family’s winemaking heritage dates back 26 generations and over 630 years in Italy. ‘Antica’ represents Antinori California, and fulfills the family’s long-standing desire to produce beautiful wines in Napa Valley.

description.data: The Antica Napa Valley  “Townsend Vineyard” Cabernet Sauvignon is a powerful expression of a bold, rich mountain Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon. brandHighlight.data: Santa Cristina, a new chapter in the long tradition of wine making. High on a Tuscan hillside sits the historic town of Cortona.  A vast plain extends on one side and on the other, the hill and village.  This is the captivating panorama surrounding the Santa Cristina winery, established in 2006 to strengthen and renew the tradition of crafting its eponymous wine, over 70 years after its first vintage.  Over time, Santa Cristina has become a reference point for winemaking experts as well as wine enthusiasts due to our commitment to achieving quality.

description.data: Delight in the rich history and artisanal touch of Santa Cristina Cabernet Sauvignon Toscana IGT Red Wine. With more than 70 years of history, passion, and dedication, this exquisite red wine perfectly balances tradition and innovation. Its soft, captivating, and contemporary style expresses Tuscan traditions in a unique yet approachable way. With a ruby red color and purplish hues, Santa Cristina Cabernet Sauvignon offers pleasant, intense fruity aromas of cherries and floral notes of violets that merge with notes of vanilla and coffee. A supple mouthfeel and fruity aftertaste make it perfect for cold cuts, medium-aged cheeses, pasta dishes, and light main courses. And with an easy-to-open screw top, no wine opener is needed, making it the perfect wine for any occasion. Experience the powerful connection between man, vines, and this land with each sip of Santa Cristina Cabernet Sauvignon Toscana IGT.

tastingNotesText.data: This Cabernet Sauvignon is deep red with violet reflections, offering aromas of black cherries and violets with hints of cocoa and coffee. On the palate, it is supple with a fruity finish - a pleasant and easy drinking wine.

brandHighlight.data: H3 wine is named after the Horse Heaven Hills AVA located in Eastern Washington. H3 wines were originally created in 2008 as a sister project of the renowned Columbia Crest Winery to showcase the high-quality grapes and vineyards of the appellation. Today, the H3 portfolio remains dedicated to creating rich, flavorful wines from the Horse Heaven Hills.

description.data:
A sensory journey awaits with H3 Chardonnay. This elegantly balanced white wine seduces your senses from the first pour, immersing you in a symphony of aromas reminiscent of an orchard in full bloom. Breathe in the captivating scents of spiced pear and crisp apples, interwoven with delicate floral notes and honey nuances. Hints of toasted coconut add an intriguing depth, enlivening the palate. As you relish each sip, a luxurious finale of creamy vanilla enfolds your taste buds, lingering with poise. At 13.5% ABV, H3 Chardonnay is a perfect companion with Alaskan Cod Chowder, where the wine's velvety notes harmonize with the dish's creaminess, or Pan-Seared Scallops, whose subtle flavors resonate with the wine's complex character. Experience the brilliance of wine craftsmanship through H3 Chardonnay - a masterpiece that will take your taste buds on an extraordinary adventure. 

Showcasing the unique terroir of the legendary Horse Heaven Hills AVA in Washington, H3 passionately crafts rich, flavorful wines. Our success thrives on the seamless collaboration between our talented winemakers and our partnerships with growers and dedicated family farmers. With an unwavering commitment, 95% of our fruit is sourced directly from these local farms, forging an unbreakable bond with the land. Together, we cultivate a story of tireless dedication, nurturing vines, and handcrafting each bottle with utmost care. So raise your glass and join our story—a celebration of the harmony between nature's gifts and human passion.

tastingNotesText.data: With spiced pear, apple, floral, honey, and toasted coconut notes, H3 Chardonnay white wine offers an elegant sensory journey, culminating in a creamy vanilla finish.

This light-medium bodied white wine is approachable, balanced and food-friendly
Fruit sourced from the Horse Heaven Hills appellation of Washington State
H3 Chardonnay is 13.5% Alcohol by Volume

flavorStatement.data: With spiced pear, apple, floral, honey, and toasted coconut notes, H3 Chardonnay white wine offers an elegant sensory journey, culminating in a creamy vanilla finish.

brandHighlight.data: Erath wines are an expression of the land that the winery has cultivated for more than 40 years, longer than any other winery in the Dundee Hills of Oregon. The red, iron-rich Jory soils, combined with gentle breezes and warming sunshine of a marine climate, have bestowed upon Dundee a terroir of note. It has given rise to the handcrafting phenomenon, and the art of Pinot.

description.data:
Discover the nuanced and complex flavors of Erath Reserve Collection Pinot Noir Red Wine, a curated blend of premium grapes sourced from top vineyard sites throughout Oregon's Willamette Valley. With aromas of black cherry, dark ripe plum, and meaty savory notes, this red wine offers a sensory journey that's both rich and enveloping. The palate is bursting with juicy blackberry, ripe fig, and tangy pomegranate, delivering a well-balanced and smooth finish that lingers on the tongue. Crafted in homage to the elegant, structured wines that put Oregon on the map, Erath Reserve Collection Pinot Noir is the perfect choice for special occasions or a luxurious night in. Wine bottles are 750 ml and have 13% ABV. Treat yourself to a bottle today and experience the art of Pinot Noir at its finest.

Erath wines are an expression of the land that the winery has cultivated for more than 40 years, longer than any other winery in the Dundee Hills of Oregon. The unique red, iron-rich Jory soils, combined with gentle breezes and warming sunshine of a marine climate, have created the perfect terroir for handcrafted wines and the art of Pinot.

tastingNotesText.data: A meticulously curated red wine from top vineyard sites in Oregon's Willamette Valley, Erath Reserve Collection Pinot Noir offers nuanced flavors of black cherry, dark plum, savory notes, blackberry, ripe fig, and tangy pomegranate, culminating in a well-balanced and smooth finish that elegantly captures the essence of this exquisite journey.

brandHighlight.data: The story of CASK 23 began during the harvest of 1974. Back then, the winery enlisted the help of celebrated winemaker André Tchelistcheff. As he tasted through various lots of new wines from that year, one lot from S.L.V. was so beautiful and deliciously distinct the winery decided it should be bottled separately. It was named CASK 23 for the large wooden cask in which it was aged. Today, the wine is a blend of the most distinctive fruit from the S.L.V and FAY vineyards, resulting in a wine of extraordinary depth and richness balanced by restraint. Over the years, CASK 23 has become one of the most highly regarded and collected wines worldwide.

description.data: The Stag's Leap Wine Cellars CASK 23 combines the signature perfume notes of FAY vineyard with the structure and dark fruit of S.L.V. Fragrant and fresh aromas of red and black currant, black tea, anise and nutmeg fill the nose. This Cabernet Sauvignon red wine has a vibrant mouthfeel with savory and velvety tannins along with blackberry and currant flavors.  Enjoy the Stag's Leap Wine Cellars Cabernet Sauvignon CASK 23 with red wine and porcini braised short ribs with polenta, honey and Calabrian Chile pork chops with roasted apples, or truffled goat cheese risotto with prosciutto, arugula and aged balsamic.

tastingNotesText.data: This is an elegant, flavorful Cabernet Sauvignon with integrated oak, refined tannins and a lasting aftertaste.  Structures of dark fruit with fresh aromas of red and black currant, black tea, anise and nutmeg that fill the nose.

text.data: One 750 ml bottle of Stag's Leap Wine Cellars CASK 23 Cabernet Sauvignon Red Wine
Full-bodied red wine with integrated oak that leads to a vibrant mouthfeel full of savory, velvety tannins along with blackberry and currant flavors
Enjoy this CASK 23 with Braised Short ribs, Pork Chops with Roasted Apples or Truffled Goat Cheese Risotto and Prosciutto
Fresh aromas of red and black currant, black tea, anise and nutmeg that fill the nose
The 2019 vintage received 95 Points from The Wine Advocate, September 2022
Cabernet Sauvignon wine that has 14.8% alcohol by volume from the Stag's Leap District in California State's Napa Valley

flavorStatement.data: This is an elegant, flavorful Cabernet Sauvignon with integrated oak, refined tannins and a lasting aftertaste.  Structures of dark fruit with fresh aromas of red and black currant, black tea, anise and nutmeg that fill the nose.

description.data:
Two Vines Riesling is a refreshing wine distinguished by ripe peach and apricot notes and a lingering slightly sweet finish. Pair this wine with Thai food, Tex-Mex cuisine or any other dish with a spicy kick.

During winemaking, the fruit was fed directly into presses where the juice was separated from the skins and seeds prior to beginning the 20-30 day fermentations. Cool temperatures throughout the winemaking process enhanced the naturally clean, floral character and crisp acidity.

brandHighlight.data: Hands of Time wines pay tribute to the many hands involved in the art of winemaking, from grower to cellar to bottle. This passion project is led  by skilled veteran winemakers and demonstrates their commitment to crafting the best wines possible in tandem with their expert cellar crews and long-time vineyard partners. Every time you’re handed a glass at your favorite restaurant or wine bar, you’re joining the celebration of the skilled hands in the legendary Napa Valley and Sonoma County.

description.data: This Sonoma County Pinot Noir offers inviting aromas of ripe strawberry, red raspberry, five spice powder, clove and licorice. Medium-bodied, the wine has a juicy core of fruit with a long and silky texture. Food-friendly and approachable, the Sonoma County Hands of Time pairs equally well with grilled salmon, roast chicken or grilled tri-tip.

brandHighlight.data: Antica is an Antinori Family estate in the Napa Valley. The family’s winemaking heritage dates back 26 generations and over 630 years in Italy. ‘Antica’ represents Antinori California, and fulfills the family’s long-standing desire to produce beautiful wines in Napa Valley.

description.data: Atlas Peak Mountain Select, high elevation fruit for this Napa Valley classic. This estate grown medium-bodied refined Chardonnay has vibrant acidity with aromas of ripe apple, pear and white peach notes. Hints of tropical fruit emerge midpalate, leading to a finish that shows savory richness. Pastry notes linger on the long, rich finish, revealing concentrated minerality and buttery nuances. A 100% Chardonnay that pairs well with shellfish, pasta with pesto, Brie cheese, grilled swordfish and halibut with creamy polenta. It has the perfect amount of oak and freshness.

tastingNotesText.data: A refined wine with vibrant acidity, backing the ripe apple, pear and white peach notes. Hints of tropical fruit emerge midpalate, leading to a finish that shows savory richness.

description.data:
Journey into the enchanting story of the Corkrum family in Walla Walla Valley with the tantalizing aromas of the Spring Valley Vineyard Katherine Corkum Cabernet Franc. This full-bodied red wine captivates with dark fruit, herbal notes, rustic dust, and a subtle almond touch. The finely structured, gratifying palate of our Spring Valley Vineyard Katherine Corkum Cabernet Franc pays homage to Katherine Corkrum, wife of Uriah Corkrum, whose essence is captured in each 750 ml bottle of wine. With 14.5% ABV, this Cab-Franc creates a connection beyond the senses, blending lively acidity and a luxuriously smooth texture. This red wine's depth and complexity pair perfectly with beef bourguignon, cassoulet, or grilled Portobello mushrooms. Raise a glass of Spring Valley Katherine Corkrum Cabernet Franc and savor Walla Walla Valley's tradition and beauty.

Spring Valley Vineyard has a profound respect for its heritage and the land it thrives upon. The family's unwavering dedication to farming the same soil for six generations inspired the names bestowed upon our wines. With each bottle of our limited-production, estate-grown red wine, you become part of their story, savoring the fruits of their labor and embracing the rich tapestry of their legacy.

brandHighlight.data: KARIA comes from a tapestry of vineyards in the southern part of Napa Valley. Vineyards in the Atlas Peak District, Oak Knoll AVA (including Danika Ranch), Carneros and Coombsville (ARCADIA VINEYARD) contributed fruit for this wine. The vineyards in Carneros (Beckstoffer Las Amigas and Carneros Creek), which are cooled in the mornings and evenings by breezes sweeping north from San Pablo Bay, contribute citrus and mineral notes to the wine. ARCADIA VINEYARD brings perfume and delicate fruit characters while our estate vineyard at Danika Ranch provides bright, juicy apple and pear personality to the blend. The fruit was picked early in the morning to keep it cool and then was whole cluster pressed to preserve the freshness. Oak and malolactic fermentation were used in moderation to accent, rather than overwhelm, the fruit.

description.data: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars KARIA is a graceful Chardonnay with inviting aromas of apricot, honeysuckle, white peach, and brioche with a mineral-floral note.  This is a medium-bodied white wine that has a bright and flavorful mouthfeel with a savory coating, texture and lingering citrus flavors. Try pairing this Chardonnay with grilled chicken with lemon aioli, grilled salmon with a cucumber, tomato and fresh dill salsa or roast chicken breast stuffed with spinach and feta cheese.

tastingNotesText.data: This is a graceful Chardonnay with inviting aromas of apricot, honeysuckle, white peach, and brioche with a mineral-floral note.

description.data:
The MERF Chardonnay is smooth, rich and balanced. With flavors of bright apple, pear, tropical fruit with delightful floral and creamy notes integrated with a nice rich mouthfeel and hints of oak in the nose and finish.

In making this wine, ripe grapes were lightly pressed and inoculated with yeast designed for accentuated, fruit-forward flavors.  Partial malolactic fermentation follows yeast fermentation for added softness, richness and complexity. It was then aged for 9 months in a combination of American and French oak with weekly stirring to soften the wine and integrate fruit and oak flavors.

tastingNotesText.data: Smooth, rich and balanced. With flavors of bright apple, pear, tropical fruit with delightful floral and creamy notes integrated with a nice rich mouthfeel and hints of oak in the nose and finish.

brandHighlight.data: Hands of Time wines pay tribute to the many hands involved in the art of winemaking, from grower to cellar to bottle. This passion project is led  by skilled veteran winemakers and demonstrates their commitment to crafting the best wines possible in tandem with their expert cellar crews and long-time vineyard partners. Every time you’re handed a glass at your favorite restaurant or wine bar, you’re joining the celebration of the skilled hands in the legendary Napa Valley and Sonoma County.

description.data: The Sonoma County Hands of Time Chardonnay has vibrant aromas of pear, pineapple, and orange blossom with a lifted floral note. Medium bodied, the wine has a soft palate balanced by pleasant acidity and a subtle touch of oak on the finish. Enjoy this food-friendly Chardonnay with grilled calamari, seared scallops or fresh pasta in a lemon-butter sauce.

brandHighlight.data: Villa Antinori was first of all an idea, a plan that envisioned the winemaking process: research and development on one side and historical heritage on the other. Villa Antinori is an important corner stone as its name is associated with over 100 years of history. At the same time it represents ongoing progress. The one essential principle is continuous research for increasingly higher quality standards. This idea produced two different wines that share a common passion for quality: Villa Antinori Rosso and Villa Antinori Bianco.

description.data: A traditional white wine produced in 1931 by Marchese Niccoló Antinori.  The white wine blend is a fine expression of the Tuscan territory by blending traditional white grape with other varieties. It is straw yellow in color with greenish highlights and offers fruity aromas of pears, peaches and green apples that unite with a delicate sensations of orange blossoms.  The palate is soft and supple with a crisp freshness and a lively, mineral finish.  Pairs this light-bodied white wine with pasta dishes, cured meats, medium-aged cheeses and seafood dishes.

tastingNotesText.data: This white wine blend is intense on the nose, it offers fruity aromas of pears, peaches and green apples that unite with delicate sensations of orange blossoms.

The wine was held in stainless steel tanks to preserve its fresh and fragrant character
Enjoy a glass of this white wine with pasta, cured meats and seafood dishes

flavorStatement.data: This white wine blend is intense on the nose, it offers fruity aromas of pears, peaches and green apples that unite with delicate sensations of orange blossoms.

brandHighlight.data: Santa Cristina, a new chapter in the long tradition of wine making. High on a Tuscan hillside sits the historic town of Cortona.  A vast plain extends on one side and on the other, the hill and village.  This is the captivating panorama surrounding the Santa Cristina winery, established in 2006 to strengthen and renew the tradition of crafting its eponymous wine, over 70 years after its first vintage.  Over time, Santa Cristina has become a reference point for winemaking experts as well as wine enthusiasts due to our commitment to achieving quality.

description.data: The Chianti Superiore is ruby red in color with purple highlights. The nose is  complex, with notes of cherries and plums well integrated with toasted oak and  vanilla derived from the aging in small barrels. The palate is ample and supple, with velvety tannins. The finish and aftertaste is long and savory.

Columbia Valley vineyards are seated in Eastern Washington. This region is mostly dry with less precipitation due to the rain shadow effect from the surrounding Cascade Mountain range. Vineyards are 100% drip irrigation. This, combined with the low water-holding capacity of the soil, allow for precise control of the vines.

brandHighlight.data: Erath wines are an expression of the land that the winery has cultivated for more than 40 years, longer than any other winery in the Dundee Hills of Oregon. The red, iron-rich Jory soils, combined with gentle breezes and warming sunshine of a marine climate, have bestowed upon Dundee a terroir of note. It has given rise to the handcrafting phenomenon, and the art of Pinot.

description.data:
Erath Estate Selection Pinot Noir Red Wine is a delightful red wine that embodies the essence of Oregon's Willamette Valley. This Pinot Noir is the perfect expression of the region's distinctive terroir, boasting inviting aromas of mixed berry vanilla cobbler, Bing cherry, and black plum, with a hint of exotic sandlewood to round out the bouquet. The palate is treated to a burst of juicy flavors, with notes of boysenberry, blackberry, and baking spice that wrap the tongue in silky smoothness. The nimble tannins offer a persistent finish, with faint mocha notes lingering pleasingly on the palate. Whether paired with wild mushrooms, duck, roast beef, lamb, other red meats, or even grilled salmon, Erath Estate Selection Pinot Noir Red Wine is sure to elevate any meal. Wine bottles are 750 ml and have 13% ABV. 

Erath wines are an expression of the land that the winery has cultivated for more than 40 years, longer than any other winery in the Dundee Hills of Oregon. The unique red, iron-rich Jory soils, combined with gentle breezes and warming sunshine of a marine climate, have created the perfect terroir for handcrafted wines and the art of Pinot. So savor the flavor and experience the essence of Oregon's Willamette Valley with Erath Estate Selection Pinot Noir.

tastingNotesText.data: Boasting inviting aromas of mixed berry vanilla cobbler, Bing cherry, and black plum, Erath Estate Selection Pinot Noir Red Wine embodies the essence of Oregon's Willamette Valley, offering a burst of juicy flavors of boysenberry, blackberry, and baking spice, with a silky smooth finish.

brandHighlight.data: S.L.V., also known as Stag’s Leap Vineyards, is the winery’s first vineyard. Planted in 1970, this vineyard achieved international fame when three-year old vines from the 1973 harvest produced a wine that stunned the wine world when it bested some of France’s greatest wines in a 1976 blind tasting known as the “Judgment of Paris.” Today, this history-making vineyard continues to produce wines with layers of complexity, spicy intensity and excellent structure—promising long life and age-ability.

description.data: The Stag's Leap Wine Cellars S.L.V. Cabernet Sauvignon offers generous dark fruit aromas of black currant, plum and candied fig along with cocoa dust. On the palate the wine has dense, yet polished, tannins that meld with layers of dark fruit, fig and violet. Enjoy our Stag's Leap Wine Cellars S.L.V. Cabernet Sauvignon with Steak Diane, Grilled Hanger steak with chimichurri, duck confit with roasted figs and polenta or mushroom Ravioli with arrabiata Sauce. As most of the 1970s-era vines have aged past their grape-producing prime, they have been gradually replanted, perpetuating the life of this historic vineyard. For this wine the primary blocks were 2A, 3A, 1A, 3B and S.L.V. Block 4 – the “grande dame” of the vineyard – which was planted in 1972. These vines along with blocks on the eastern side of S.L.V., characterized by their fire-borne volcanic soils, give this wine its structure and sense of minerality along with concentrated dark fruit flavors and ripe, elegant tannins. Vines in alluvial soils in the western part of the vineyard add vibrant fruit accent notes and heady aromatics.

tastingNotesText.data: The S.L.V. Cabernet Sauvignon offers generous dark fruit aromas of black currant, plum and candied fig along with cocoa dust. On the palate the wine has dense, yet polished, tannins that meld with layers of dark fruit, fig and violet.

brandHighlight.data:
Founded in 1994 by Don and Jennifer Hartford, the Hartford Family Winery resides in a French-style chateau in the town of Forestville, in the southwestern Russian River Valley. The winery specializes in small lots of vineyard-designated wines of high personality. The wines are labeled with two distinct marks: Hartford Court for the Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, and Hartford for old-vine Zinfandel from the Russian River Valley. In recent years, Hartford Family Winery has produced over 25 single-vineyard wines from discrete vineyard blocks from extraordinary vineyard sites extending from Sta. Rita Hills in California north to Eola-Amity Hills in Oregon.
  
Hartford Family Winery was founded in 1994 as a result of Don and Jennifer Hartford’s appreciation for the wines, the people, and the unique vineyards near their Russian River Valley home. Located in the Sonoma County town of Forestville, the winery is about 15 miles from the cool Pacific Coast.

Making delicious wines of high personality is directly related to the difficult locations of our vineyard sources, the limited production of our bottlings and the varietals we use. “Character through adversity” is an expression that we believe applies to people and grapevines and surviving adversity builds character, and personality, in both.

Hartford Family Winery specializes in making wines from single vineyard sites. In recent vintages we have made about 25 different single vineyard bottlings. Small and low-yielding vineyards deliver expressive and personality-rich wine. Our single vineyard Hartford Court Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays total as few as 93 cases, up to about 800 cases. Likewise, our Hartford Old Vine Zinfandels are produced in small quantities. Our single vineyard wines are highly allocated.

description.data: The Hartford Court Muldune Trail Anderson Valley Pinot Noir has vibrant fruit aromas of blueberry, raspberry, and plum, which are the hallmarks of the wine’s aromatics along with a subtle cedar/cigar box note. These aromatics lead into voluptuous flavors of berries and spice in this structured, yet lively Pinot Noir. Vibrant fruit aromas of blueberry, raspberry, and plum are the hallmarks of this red wine along with a subtle cedar, cigar box note. These aromatics lead into voluptuous flavors of berries and spice. Pair with duck breast in a cherry reduction sauce with morel mushrooms and risotto.  This bottled California pinot noir is 15% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: Vibrant fruit aromas of blueberry, raspberry, and plum are the hallmarks of this red wine along with a subtle cedar, cigar box note. These aromatics lead into voluptuous flavors of berries and spice.

brandHighlight.data: Family owned since its founding in 1961, Heitz Cellar's legacy runs as deep as the roots throughout the Napa Valley; a winery legend that has helped shape the history of Napa Valley winemaking. In the late 1950's, pioneering vintner Joe Heitz ushered in Napa's modern era with his iconic, globally celebrated wines, including Napa Valley's first vineyard-designated Cabernet Sauvignon, the renowned Heitz Cellar Martha's Vineyard. Sixty years of the Heitz family's dedication to viticulture, stewardship, and classic winemaking, maintained the winery's notoriety as a benchmark amongst its peers in California and Europe. The wines are made with an unwavering commitment to quality from organically farmed, 100% Napa Valley fruit, and a commitment to the sustainability of Napa Valley.

description.data: The Heitz Cellar Napa Valley Cabernet Suavignon is sourced from our vineyards throughout the Napa Valley, each of which ocntirbutes different sensory attributes to the final blend. The pupose behind the Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon is to create a wine that is representative of Napa Valley and to highlight all the qualities that make this area one of the world's premier wine growing regions. We continue to craft this wine to be a 100% Cabernet Sauvignon blend and is made in the signature Heitz style to be fresh, elegantly structured, and built with the option for aging or enjoying upon release.

tastingNotesText.data: The cooler to moderate temperatures during hte growing season allowed us to balance sugar and phenolic maturity in the fruit while maintaining natural acidity to help preserve the fresh characteristics of the vintage. The elegance and balanced structure of the 2018 vintage will make this an incredible wine to drink upon release and will continue to reward with cellar aging.

text.data: Only three winemakers have presided (Joe Heitz, David Heitz and Brittany Sherwood); vineyards have been solely managed by Jack Neal & Son
100% of vineyards are grown certified CCOF organic, with a move towards biodynamic farming started in 2026
Harvesting at lower Brix preserves high natural acidity while patient aging ensures freshness and elegance with the purest expression of terroir

description.data: Inspired by the renowned rosé wines of Provence, France, the DAOU Rosé remains faithful to its origins. This wine is remarkably fragrant, offering generous aromas of fresh peach, Bartlett pear and nectarine, with subtle notes of hyacinth, apricot and crushed rose petals. The palate is delightfully silky, underlying a clean, fresh crispness delivering enticing flavors of mango, Crenshaw melon, lemon chiffon and tangerine. Secondary layers reveal hints of sweet cherry and vanilla with orange peel accents. A luxurious and lasting finish leaves traces of apple pie, strawberry and kiwi.

description.data: The DAOU Cabernet Sauvignon exemplifies Paso Robles. The nose is highly perfumed, showing aromas of black cherry, cassis, plum, desert sage, sandalwood and dusty minerality. Secondary aromas reveal notes of cigar box, leather, bay leaf and black olive. The palate is rich and weighty, offering generous flavors of black raspberry, spicy currant and blueberry compote with impressions of Bing cherry, boysenberry, fig and baking spices. Ripe, fine-grained tannins carry into a structured finish with lingering accents of cherry, espresso and vanilla.

description.data: The 2019 PATRIMONY Cabernet Sauvignon is nothing short of a blockbuster wine from a banner vintage, meticulously shepherded to greatness by Winemaker Daniel Daou. This 100-percent Cabernet Sauvignon from DAOU Mountain is the epitome of a terroir-driven wine that displays immense power without sacrificing elegance. It explodes from the glass with boysenberry, crème de cassis, cedar, cigar, crushed stone and lead pencil accompanied by a perfume of violets. Deep, full bodied and rich with astonishing texture, it manages to stay fresh and balanced throughout an unending finish. This wine will ultimately reveal its complete and extraordinary potential after several years in the bottle.

description.data: The DAOU Chardonnay displays a rich, ample nose of pineapple, vanilla bean, mango, hazelnut and nutmeg spice. Floral tones of honeysuckle and star jasmine are accented by sweet ginger and lemon zest. The palate is weighty and mouthfilling, delivering round, silky flavors of Bartlett pear, Crenshaw melon, kiwi and fresh pineapple. Notes of Golden Delicious apple and papaya are complemented with lemon cream pie and crushed almonds, while hints of white peach, citrus peel and cinnamon linger on a long, graceful finish.

description.data: DAOU Pinot Noir from Santa Barbara County offers an attractive nose of wild raspberries, succulent red cherries and pomegranate. Notes of sandalwood and baking spice mingle with suggestions of mushroom, African violets, new leather and toasty oak. Rounding out this elegant bouquet are hints of damp pine forest floor, rosehip tea and dark chocolate. On the palate, an astonishing purity of fruit flavor erupts with ripe cherry, cranberry, boysenberry and rhubarb, with trailing nuances of freshly sliced strawberries. Earthy truffle and pencil-lead minerality provide the foundation and balance for this exquisite wine, supporting a lengthy finish of plum, kirsch and pine needle.

brandHighlight.data:
Lokoya is a collection of four distinct Cabernet Sauvignons from four of Napa Valley’s most celebrated mountain appellations: Mount Veeder, Howell Mountain, Spring Mountain and Diamond Mountain. These limited-production wines are 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, fermented with native yeast, and bottled unfined and unfiltered, resulting in the purest expression of place.
  
Established in 1995, Lokoya is a collection of four distinct Cabernet Sauvignons from four of Napa Valley’s most celebrated mountain appellations: Mount Veeder, Howell Mountain, Spring Mountain and Diamond Mountain. These limited-production wines are 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, fermented with native yeast, and bottled unfined and unfiltered, resulting in the purest expression of place. Cabernet Sauvignon as lens, site as conveyor—the grape variety and winemaking for the four wines remain constant, allowing the vineyard sites to shine with the climate, soils and sunlight all fully expressed in the glass. Given the high elevation of the sites, the vineyards demand constant attention. The deep understanding of the vineyard trajectory in each vintage comes from Winemaker Christopher Carpenter’s years of expertise. Intervention is kept to a minimum both in the vineyard and in the cellar, leaving the fruit to express itself as naturally and eloquently as possible.

description.data: The wines of Lokoya are crafted to express the purest sense of place. This wine is made from high elevation vineyards located in the Diamond Mountain District and showcases the rich black cherry flavor dark chocolate and relatively soft tannins this region is known for. This red wine shows notes of dark chocolate, forest floor, and graphite. Full-bodied wine that shows rich blackberry, creme de cassis flavors with relatively soft tannins. Pair with filet mignon or any red meat on the grill, pork tenderloin and potatoes.  This bottled California cabernet sauvignon is 14.5% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This red wine shows notes of dark chocolate, forest floor, and graphite. Full-bodied wine that shows rich blackberry, creme de cassis flavors with relatively soft tannins.

• Dry, Rich Wine that is Purple in Color
• Pair with filet mignon or any red meat on the grill, pork tenderloin and potatoes

description.data: This highly textured wine displays aromas of yellow apple, orange blossom, honeysuckle and tangerine skin. Fresh flavors of Granny Smith apple and Meyer lemon are intertwined with layers of spice and crystallized ginger. A rich and weighty mid-palate is followed by a very long exotic, mineral infused finish. This rich white wine displays aromas of citrus, apple and honeysuckle. Flavors of apple and lemon mingle with crystallized ginger. A weighty mid-palate is followed by a long, mineral infused finish. Pair with white fish and other seafood, chicken, and pasta in creamy white sauce.  This bottled California chardonnay is 14.6% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This rich white wine displays aromas of citrus, apple and honeysuckle. Flavors of apple and lemon mingle with crystallized ginger. A weighty mid-palate is followed by a long, mineral infused finish.

brandHighlight.data:
The Cannonball icon is a symbol of your inner child, a time when life was carefree and all about having fun - that uninhibited spirit is the soul of Cannonball wines. Founded in 2006, Cannonball wines are sourced from select regions throughout California. The diverse California microclimates, topography and soils provide the perfect palette to create wines that are complex, highly consistent, and a pure expression of the varietal. The diverse California microclimates, topography and soils provide the perfect palette to create wines that are complex, highly consistent, and a pure expression of the varietal. Diversifying sourcing allows for flexibility to achieve our signature style and maintain continuity with each vintage. 

DIVE IN & SHARE A SPLASH!

description.data: High Dive Napa Valley began in 2014 as an adventurous collaboration between SHARE A SPLASH wine co. Founder Yoav Gilat  and winemakers Peter Heitz (Turnbull Wine Cellars) and Scott Palazzo (Palazzo Wines).  A ‘Left Bank’ Bordeaux-styled blend, High Dive is a proprietary red that is an homage to the classic Napa Valley blends of the 1970s. The three wine industry friends came together over a shared vision to create a Cabernet blend that would take you to the root of what first made Napa Valley so beloved. The winemaking dream team – Peter, a 4th generation winemaker from Napa that specializes in structured Cabs from Oakville and Scott bringing a ‘Right Bank’ Bordeaux expertise – set out to craft an elegant, proprietary red that would showcase the best of Napa’s terroir, with classic restraint.

description.data: The Snitch Napa Valley Chardonnay White Wine is a barrel aged wine with vibrant flavors and aromas of tropical fruit, apple and pear. A fresh approach to the traditional chardonnay wine varietal, this California white wine combines chardonnay grapes from premier vineyards in Napa Valley's warm Oak Knoll and cool-climate Carneros with just a touch of roussanne, resulting in a blend of distinct quality and character. Aged for 14 months in old and new French oak barrels, this Napa Valley wine offers richness balanced by bright acidity, making it a great companion for fish, pork and poultry dishes or shellfish and a natural part of a wine and cheese platter. For best taste and quality, refrigerate this table white wine for two to two and a half hours and serve chilled. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2023 The Prisoner Wine Company, Oakville, CA

tastingNotesText.data: Chardonnay wine with vibrant aromas and flavors of tropical fruit, apple, and pear in each glass of wine. Table white wine with richness balanced by bright acidity.

description.data: SIMI Winery was built on the spirit of always striving and constantly evolving. It’s what fueled us forward since 1876. Our SIMI Sonoma County Dry Rose is a tribute to Isabelle Simi, whose 80 year legacy at SIMI Winery is the foundation of this fighting spirit. A dry style Rose showcasing fruity and delightfully fresh flavors with a crisp, clean finish. Enjoy this refreshing, light wine as a tasty aperitif or as the perfect companion to a green salad, chicken and pork dishes, pasta or even fresh fruit and feta. To preserve its taste and quality, refrigerate this SIMI wine for at least two hours, and serve chilled. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2023 SIMI Winery, Healdsburg, CA

brandHighlight.data: Astrolabe is named after the ship that charted and explored the Marlborough Coast in 1827. Simon's personal style defines an Astrolabe wine — focused, balanced and elegant. He crafts a range of beautiful wines that express the purity and intensity of fruit flavors afforded by the climate and soils of the Marlborough region. Careful site selection, expert picking decisions, delicate fruit handling and astute blending are the hallmarks of the Astrolabe Marlborough wines.

description.data: Founded in 1996 and named after the ship that in 1827 charted and explored the Marlborough Coast, Astrolabe wines were created by seasoned winemaker Simon Waghorn together with his wife Jane. Simon crafts a range of beautiful wines that express the purity and intensity of fruit flavours afforded by the climate and soils of the Marlborough region. All grapes are sourced from ten families who live on their land and farm sustainably. These carefully chosen sites add complexity and completeness in the wines. The Astrolabe Marlborough Pinot Noir is made from a variety of pinot noir clones from vines grown across the wider Marlborough wine region. It  shows powerful fruit expression with characteristics of red and black cherry that dominate the flavour profile.

Simon crafts a range of beautiful wines that express the purity and intensity of fruit flavours afforded by the climate and soils of the Marlborough region. description.data: Founded in 1996 and named after the ship that in 1827 charted and explored the Marlborough Coast, Astrolabe wines were created by seasoned winemaker Simon Waghorn together with his wife Jane. Simon crafts a range of beautiful wines that express the purity and intensity of fruit flavours afforded by the climate and soils of the Marlborough region. Astrolabe Wines is proud to be fully committed to producing wines sustainably. All aspects of our production are sustainably certified under the Sustainable Winegrowing New Zealand program. The Astrolabe Awatere Valley Sauvignon Blanc is grown in more extreme climate than most of Marlborough, with strong winds, variable soils, greater temperature fluctuations and a later ripening season. Vines are planted from sea level to quite high altitude, and the scarceness of irrigation water is often limiting to vine growth. As a result, the grape berry size is reduced, and flavours can be more intense.

description.data: Founded in 1996 and named after the ship that in 1827 charted and explored the Marlborough Coast, Astrolabe wines were created by seasoned winemaker Simon Waghorn together with his wife Jane. Simon crafts a range of beautiful wines that express the purity and intensity of fruit flavours afforded by the climate and soils of the Marlborough region. Astrolabe Wines is proud to be fully committed to producing wines sustainably. All aspects of our production are sustainably certified under the Sustainable Winegrowing New Zealand program. Located on Marlborough’s Kēkerengū Coast and the southernmost vineyard in Astrolabe’s range, the Sauvignon Blanc from the organically-farmed  Taihoa Vineyard is tightly structured, intense and mineral driven. The gravelly-limestone soils are free draining and the elevated terraces allow for good airflow helping create wines with complexity, texture and age-worthiness.

brandHighlight.data: Twin Vines is produced by José Maria da Fonseca, one of Portugal’s most prestigious and historic wine producers.  Established in 1834, the winery has been family owned and operated by seven generations of the Soares Franco family. Twin Vines is named after the 8th generation, Twin daughters of Antonio Soares Franco, Marketing and Commercial Director for JMF.

description.data:
Produced by José Maria da Fonseca, one of Portugal’s most prestigious and historic wine producers.  Established in 1834, the winery has been family owned and operated by seven generations of the Soares Franco family. JMF follows a philosophy of permanent development, constantly investing in research and production, and are  equipped with the latest technology, which competes with the best in the world. 
Twin Vines Vinho Verde was conceived to commemorate the 8th generation of the Soares Franco family, the twin daughters of Antonio Soares, owner of Jose Maria da Fonseca winery. It is a DOC classified wine and is blend of Loureiro and Alvarinho.

brandHighlight.data: AMERICA'S #1 ALCOHOL REMOVED WINE! FRE brings you all the delight of a magnificent glass of wine, without the alcohol. FRE is here for your life moments, choices, and celebrations, because – true happiness lies in the freedom to be yourself. Each FRE wine is crafted using traditional winemaking methods. Once crafted, the wine goes through state-of-the-art spinning cone technology to remove the alcohol while safeguarding the fragile wine aromas and flavors. The result is a delicious beverage with the characteristics of premium California wine.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: FRE Alcohol-Removed Rosé Wine is a delicate, pink-hued non-alcoholic wine that makes any occasion special. Crisp, fruity strawberry and citrus flavors mingle with ripe berry accents leading to a beautiful, refreshing finish. Pair this alcohol-removed dry wine with grilled fish or summer salad.  It is a blush wine sourced from California’s warm inland valleys, where plenty of sunshine brings out ripe fruit flavors and mouthwatering acidity. This pink wine goes through state-of-the-art spinning cone technology to remove the alcohol while safeguarding the delicate aromas and flavors of a traditional glass of wine. The finished product is a fresh, delicious beverage with the characteristic aromas and flavors of premium Rose wine. This bottled wine has less than 0.5% alcohol by volume and half the calories of regular wine. FRE is America's #1 alcohol-removed wine.

This non-alcoholic red wine is delightful to drink on its own, mixed in a craft mocktail, or paired with herb-crusted lamb chops, hearty stews, spaghetti or pizza. brandHighlight.data: Did you know that Middle Sister wines were inspired by a real Middle Sister? True story! Our founder Terry Wheatley was fascinated by the middle daughter of one of her best friends, named Erin. From childhood, she was just more outrageous, more free-spirited, simply larger than life. Terry created Middle Sister wines for middle sisters everywhere. So you finally get the attention you deserve! xoxo

description.data: Inspired by Middle Sisters everywhere, Middle Sister Rebel Red is an award-winning wine sourced from only the most premium California vineyards. If you drink what you like, and like what you drink try this wine with aromas of plums, blueberries, and blackberries with a dollop of crème de cassis. Rebel Red is a Red Wine blend that bends the rules and never fits the mold.

brandHighlight.data: Layer Cake’s name was born out of the simplicity of something handmade, a quality token of love like a cake your grandmother would have made for you on a special occasion. With richly layered flavors from the best regions on earth, Layer Cake wines have a level of depth and complexity that allow you to taste the terroir of the wine-making region, the unique characteristics of the fruit, and the experienced touch of the winemaker.

description.data: This wine pops with aromas of blackberry, spice, blueberry, and sweet toasty oak notes. On the palate experience round juicy macerated berries, black plum, allspice, and blue fruit.

tastingNotesText.data: This wine pops with aromas of blackberry, spice, blueberry, and sweet toasty oak notes. On the palate experience round juicy macerated berries, black plum, allspice, and blue fruit.

brandHighlight.data: Layer Cake’s name was born out of the simplicity of something handmade, a quality token of love like a cake your grandmother would have made for you on a special occasion. With richly layered flavors from the best regions on earth, Layer Cake wines have a level of depth and complexity that allow you to taste the terroir of the wine-making region, the unique characteristics of the fruit, and the experienced touch of the winemaker.

description.data:
Layer Cake Rosé is perfectly pale pink and reminiscent of rose gold liquefied in the glass. Aromas of passion fruit, pink grapefruit and dried rose petals mingle with the slightest hint of cranberry. On the palate, tropical flavors of guava and crushed loquat harmonize with
field-ripened strawberries, picked fresh for the farmers market. The vibrant acidity is layered with pink grapefruit zest and rhubarb that culminates in a bone dry, refreshing finish.

tastingNotesText.data:
Layer Cake Rosé is perfectly pale pink and reminiscent of rose gold liquefied in the glass. Aromas of passion fruit, pink grapefruit and dried rose petals mingle with the slightest hint of cranberry. On the palate, tropical flavors of guava and crushed loquat harmonize with
field-ripened strawberries, picked fresh for the farmers market. The vibrant acidity is layered with pink grapefruit zest and rhubarb that culminates in a bone dry, refreshing finish.
