brandHighlight.data: Layer Cake’s name was born out of the simplicity of something handmade, a quality token of love like a cake your grandmother would have made for you on a special occasion. With richly layered flavors from the best regions on earth, Layer Cake wines have a level of depth and complexity that allow you to taste the terroir of the wine-making region, the unique characteristics of the fruit, and the experienced touch of the winemaker.

description.data: The Layer Cake Sea of Stones Red Blend is extremely dense and concentrated. Opaque purple, almost black in color, the aroma is full of ripe black fruit, grilled bread, pencil lead, wet stones, lavender, blueberry pie, and black cherry. On the palate there is layer upon layer of savory fruit, spice notes, espresso, and dark chocolate as well as rich, creamy texture. The aromas and flavors carry on long after the wine is gone from your mouth, the finish taunting you to have another sip.

tastingNotesText.data: The Layer Cake Sea of Stones Red Blend is extremely dense and concentrated. Opaque purple, almost black in color, the aroma is full of ripe black fruit, grilled bread, pencil lead, wet stones, lavender, blueberry pie, and black cherry. On the palate there is layer upon layer of savory fruit, spice notes, espresso, and dark chocolate as well as rich, creamy texture. The aromas and flavors carry on long after the wine is gone from your mouth, the finish taunting you to have another sip.

brandHighlight.data: Wine Sisterhood is an online community where women can join the conversation about wine, food, travel, style and entertaining. We know that sisterhood is powerful, and our mission is to entertain, educate, inform, and inspire.

description.data: What is a sister? A sister can be your parent’s daughter or not. A sister says you’re doing great even if you’re just hanging on. A sister will wash the dishes if you do the cooking. A sister says you don’t look good in that dress even though a saleslady says you do. A sister will pour you the last glass of wine. A sister is there for as long that it takes to get the job done, even if the job involves lots of baking. A sister is someone who loves you. Share this wine with a sister

brandHighlight.data: Founded in 1998, Tamarack Cellars strives to be the picture of excellence. Sourcing grapes from the most renowned vineyards in Washington State and handcrafting our wines barrel by barrel. Whether it's our ever popular Firehouse Red or one of the limited-production single vineyard reserve blends, Tamarack's wines offer a delicious expression of Washington vineyards' style and elegance in every bottle.

description.data: Founded in 1998, Tamarack Cellars strives to be the picture of excellence, sourcing grapes from the most renowned vineyards in Washington State and handcrafting our wines barrel by barrel. The Tamarack Cellars Firehouse White has aromas of walking into a peach orchard in bloom, with guava and hints of Golden Delicious apple, vibrant acidity and a touch of viscosity lead to flavors of stone fruits, honey and slate minerality finishing gently with mango, apricot and floral tannins. Recommended food pairings include Enjoy chilled.

tastingNotesText.data: This inaugural release of Firehouse White has aromas of walking into a peach orchard in bloom, with guava and hints of Golden Delicious apple, vibrant acidity and a touch of viscosity lead to flavors of stone fruits, honey and slate minerality finishing gently with mango, apricot and floral tannins.

brandHighlight.data: Cosentino Winery is renowned for creating the first designated and licensed Meritage wine, Bordeaux inspired blend that set the standard that others would follow in Napa Valley. Today, Cosentino Winery has grown in quality and reputation and continues to gain recognition for innovative winemaking. After over 35 years of winemaking, our commitment to the future is still focused on producing quality ultra-premium wines.

description.data: Cosentino Winery has produced wines for 35 years from two of California's finest growing regions, Napa Valley and Lodi. description.data: What is a sister? A sister can be your parent’s daughter or not. A sister says you’re doing great even if you’re just hanging on. A sister will wash the dishes if you do the cooking. A sister says you don’t look good in that dress even though a saleslady says you do. A sister will pour you the last glass of wine. brandHighlight.data:
Founded in 1996, Brewer-Clifton wines are a reflection of the geographic, geologic and climatic uniqueness of California’s Sta. Rita Hills appellation in Santa Barbara County. Founder and Winemaker Greg Brewer has spent the entirety of his three-decade career dedicated to crafting cool-climate Chardonnay and Pinot Noir from this finite stretch of land. Greg passionately and ritualistically creates wines of intensity, complexity and specificity to convey the characteristics inherent to each vineyard sites, with uncompromising quality.
  
At Brewer – Clifton, we believe that the geographic, geologic and climatic uniqueness of the Sta. Rita Hills appellation provide an ideal place to grow Chardonnay and Pinot Noir of intensity, complexity and specificity. Our mission and indeed our passion is to present wines that convey the characteristics inherent to each of our vineyard sites, with uncompromising quality.

Winemaker Greg Brewer’s primary focus in the winery is the pursuit of refinement. He is engaged in every aspect of his work, from vineyard to market, and every level of the process is given equal priority. To him, a mindful approach where strategic and efficient actions are taken to incorporate the needs of the entire ecosystem creates a confident and calming environment, a space where everyone and everything is appreciated. The goal is the beauty and synchronicity of the system. The result is wine that is honest and driven, expressive of the place and the team who collectively steward them.

description.data: This bottling is comprised of 100% Estate pinot noir from three vineyards within the AVA. 3D, Machado and Acin all contribute to the wine which exhibits a drive, richness and pedigree expressive of our special growing area coupled with the purity of fruit and firm structure which have been the trademark of Brewer – Clifton. This red wine expresses the purity of fruit and a firm, savory structure by delicately balancing aromas of pomegranate, white tea, and raspberry, against flavors of dried fig, white truffle and cherry. Pair with grilled beef, duck breast with fig sauce and risotto.  This bottled California pinot noir is 14.5% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This red wine expresses the purity of fruit and a firm, savory structure by delicately balancing aromas of pomegranate, white tea, and raspberry, against flavors of dried fig, white truffle and cherry.

pictureTypeCode.description: mobile ready hero image
pictureTypeCode.label: Mobile Ready Hero Image

brandHighlight.data: Sterling Napa Valley wines show the depth, strength and expressive quality of California’s most famous wine region. Fruit for Sterling wines is grown throughout Napa Valley, from the cool southern Carneros region next to San Pablo Bay to the rugged northernmost benchlands and reaches near our Calistoga homeplace. Sterling has more than five decades of winemaking excellence in Napa Valley, and winemaker Lauren Kopit is able to build from that experience to select the finest lots to create memorable expressions for each vintage.

description.data: Rich and full bodied, Sterling Vineyards Platinum Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon Red Wine is classic Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, in distinctive Sterling style. Handcrafted from exceptional fruit and carefully nurtured and aged for 19 months in French, Hungarian, and American Oak, this rich, full-bodied Cabernet wine offers plush red fruit flavors and aromas, with hints of caramel toffee and oak spice framed by polished tannins. Sterling Vineyards was founded in 1964 by Oxford graduate and successful businessman Peter Newton. Newton was an early pioneer of crafting Bordeaux-inspired red wines in California and helped transform the Napa Valley region into the premier winemaking appellation we know today.

tastingNotesText.data: Platinum is a wine designed to bring a singular thought to life: great wines come from great vineyards, and never so much as when the winemaking and winegrowing teams work hand in hand to carefully nurture the finest fruit toward a well -rewarded harvest. In this vintage, Platinum Cabernet exhibits the purity of fruit expression, polished tannins and rich texture that are the essential signature of this rich, full -bodied wine. As the drought subsided fruit was more expressive, showing aromas and flavors of red and dark fruit such as Bing cherry, with notable vanilla essence from the American oak. The wine is well integrated, nicely structured with medium tannins that suggest a possibility for at least some cellaring. Recognizable cabernet highlights such as mocha, cassis and caramel toffee join with white pepper spice, leading to a lingering, lasting impression. A beautiful expression of Napa’s varied growing regions.

Fruit for Sterling wines is grown throughout Napa Valley, from the cool southern Carneros region next to San Pablo Bay to the rugged northernmost benchlands and reaches near our Calistoga homeplace. description.data: Complex and food-friendly, this plush and balanced Sterling Vineyards Napa Valley Merlot Red Wine comes from some of the best vineyards surrounding the winery. It's perfect for everyday meals and special occasions. 18-month oak-aging adds generous spice and polished, silky tannins. Enjoy this Merlot wine with grilled pork chops or roasted game hens. Sterling Vineyards was founded in 1964 by Oxford graduate and successful businessman Peter Newton. Newton was an early pioneer of crafting Bordeaux-inspired red wines in California and helped transform the Napa Valley region into the premier winemaking appellation we know today.

tastingNotesText.data: This Napa Valley Merlot is a vivid ruby-red color in the glass with aromas of blackberry fruit, stone fruits like plum and black cherry. The inviting bouquet leads to a mouthcoating, rich palate where additional red and black fruit flavors intertwine with notes of dried spice. The mouthfeel is plush and the ripe tannins are refined and polished. Well-balanced and elegant, this Merlot offers true varietal characteristics with a sleek, flavorful finish.

brandHighlight.data: Champagne Legras & Haas was established in 1991 by François and Brigitte Legras (nee Haas) in Chouilly, where François’ family have been growing grapes for four centuries. Today the estate vineyards and winery is managed by their three sons, Olivier, Rémi and Jérôme. The Legras-Haas family cultivates 18 hectares of vines, comprised of 35 parcels, within Grand Cru Chouilly in the Côte des Blancs, which allows them to produce different expressions of Blanc de Blancs. In total the family farms almost 37 hectares in Champagne. As stewards of their vines, they respect and maintain the ecosystem so together they may deliver dynamic wines that are aromatic, graceful, fresh and ultimately expose a beguiling complexity.

description.data: The Legras family produce a millésime only in outstanding vintages that also possess dynamism and ageability. Every second of tasting brings both palpable richness and intense freshness, supported by an abundance of nuances; this complexity beguiles the next sip.

tastingNotesText.data: An exotic aromatic profile leads to tropical character on the palate, which is unusual in Chouilly, and it is supported by savory and saline notes, which give this vintage impressive balance and poise.

text.data: Family-owned winery in Chouilly, a Grand Cru in the coveted Cote de Blancs
6th generation working together, three passionate brothers continue the Legras family tradition of winegrowing and wine blending
Estate vineyards comprise over 36 hectares in Grand Cru Chouilly, Vitry and Les Riceys
Winemaking focuses on terroir expression and ageability; style delivers freshness, purity, grace, depth and energy
Blanc de Blancs specialists exposing the potential of Chardonnay across multiple stylistic takes each year

description.data: Exigence is the pinnacle of the blends tier - a mix of estate and negociant fruit - and is constructed from a perpetual reserve that dates back to 1995. Given the blend of vintages, this wine is defined by its unique geographical origins, which amplifies the aromatic complexity. Half the grapes for this wine are from the family's estate vineyards in Chouilly in the Côte des Blancs, while the other half are purchased from a long-term partner in Aÿ. The finished wine is made from 100% first press musts and 100% Grand Cru grapes; classic and timeless, incredibly rich and smooth, it is an invitation to collect Champagne.

tastingNotesText.data: Compelling aromas of freshly baked brioche and peach pie lead into a complex, vinous wine that maintains its precision and freshness

description.data:
A passionate grape grower and liberal thinker, Philip Mazzei (1730-1816) best represents the innovative, visionary and entrepreneurial spirit that has characterized the Mazzei family throughout its history. Philip was the first to introduce vines from Tuscany to the USA.

A blend of the finest Cabernet Sauvignon selected from the Mazzei’s estates of Fonterutoli and Belguardo.  Combines the fragrance and elegance typical of the traditional area of Chianti Classico, with the opulence and power of the more contemporary Maremma region. Rich, yet supple and silky.

brandHighlight.data: Dating to the 17th century, the Marcello de Majno estate is in the Prosecco Treviso DOC adjacent to the esteemed Conegliano area. Abundant light, Adriatic winds and the Venetian pre-Alps provide the terroir to fully express the Glera grape. All the wines are sourced from estate grapes, which means that quality is ensured from grape to glass. Giovanni Mazzei initiated a renaissance at his maternal grandmother's estate in Veneto with Villa Marcello.

description.data: Villa Marcello Prosecco is all estate grown in Treviso. A touch of Pinot Bianco adds depth to this single-vintage wine, and the use of minimal dosage reveals a prosecco with elegance and purity.

tastingNotesText.data: An enticing blend of William pear, lime and flowers encourage another sip of this sophisticated and full-bodied wine.

brandHighlight.data: Established in 1435, the Mazzei family is one of Tuscany’s oldest wine dynasties, cultivating vineyards and crafting fine wine for over 600 years in Fonterutoli in the heart of Chianti Classico. Heritage is balanced with innovation as the family established benchmark wines in newly prominent regions like the Maremma and Sicily with their Belguardo and Zisola estate wineries. All of the estates are farmed with a commitment to reducing environmental impact and fostering sustainability.

description.data: The Mazzei family spent over twenty years cultivating 36 unique biotypes of Sangiovese, including 18 massal selections from their oldest vineyards. This wine is the culmination of that work – a pure-bred Chianti Classico Gran Selezione showcasing those 36 selections from a single vineyard in Castelnuovo Berardenga.

tastingNotesText.data: Intensity, colour deepness, strong and bright bouquet

brandHighlight.data:
The Cannonball icon is a symbol of your inner child, a time when life was carefree and all about having fun - that uninhibited spirit is the soul of Cannonball wines. Founded in 2006, Cannonball wines are sourced from select regions throughout California. The diverse California microclimates, topography and soils provide the perfect palette to create wines that are complex, highly consistent, and a pure expression of the varietal. The diverse California microclimates, topography and soils provide the perfect palette to create wines that are complex, highly consistent, and a pure expression of the varietal. Diversifying sourcing allows for flexibility to achieve our signature style and maintain continuity with each vintage. 

DIVE IN & SHARE A SPLASH!

description.data: The Cannonball icon is a symbol of your inner child, a time when life was carefree and all about having fun – that uninhibited spirit is the soul of Cannonball wines. The diverse California microclimates, topography and soils provide the perfect palette to create wines that are complex, highly consistent, and a pure expression of the varietal. Cannonball Sauvignon Blanc captures the essence of freshness and vibrancy with flavors of grapefruit, apricot and fresh lychee, while its zesty acidity brings the wine to life.

flavorStatement.data: Bright and refreshing from bouquet to finish, this Sauvignon Blanc displays floral, grassy and citrus notes with a bouquet of Meyer lemon, white blossoms, lime, and mint. The crisp acidity keeps the palate lively and lifted with citrus and apricot along with notes of honeydew melon and basil, with a lingering mineral finish. Amazing with shellfish, poultry or as an aperitif.

description.data: The 2022 DAOU Cabernet Sauvignon exemplifies Paso Robles. The nose is highly perfumed, showing aromas of black cherry, cassis, plum, desert sage, sandalwood and dusty minerality. Secondary aromas reveal notes of cigar box, leather, bay leaf and black olive. The palate is rich and weighty, offering generous flavors of black raspberry, spicy currant and blueberry compote with impressions of Bing cherry, boysenberry, fig and baking spices. Ripe, fine-grained tannins carry into a structured finish with lingering accents of cherry, espresso and vanilla.

description.data:
The 2022 DAOU Chardonnay displays a rich, ample nose of pineapple, vanilla bean, mango, hazelnut and nutmeg spice. Floral tones of honeysuckle and star jasmine are accented by sweet ginger and lemon zest. The palate is weighty and mouthfilling, delivering round, silky flavors of Bartlett pear, Crenshaw melon, kiwi and fresh pineapple. Notes of Golden Delicious apple and papaya are complemented with lemon cream pie and crushed almonds, while hints of white peach, citrus peel and cinnamon linger on a
long, graceful finish.

description.data: The 2020 Pinot Noir from Santa Barbara County offers an attractive nose of wild raspberries, succulent red cherries and pomegranate. Notes of sandalwood and baking spice mingle with suggestions of mushroom, African violets, new leather and toasty oak. Rounding out this elegant bouquet are hints of damp pine forest floor, rosehip tea and dark chocolate. On the palate, an astonishing purity of fruit flavor erupts with ripe cherry, cranberry, boysenberry and rhubarb, with trailing nuances of freshly sliced strawberries. Earthy truffle and pencil-lead minerality provide the foundation and balance for this exquisite wine, supporting a lengthy finish of plum, kirsch and pine needle.

description.data:
Lovely and bright—a quintessential rendition of Paso Robles Sauvignon Blanc. Tantalizing aromas of grapefruit, pineapple, gooseberry and quince reveal floral impressions of lemongrass
and acacia, all balanced by notes of lychee and wet stone. The palate is classily structured and elegantly styled, displaying crisp, juicy fruit flavors that burst across the palate, including lemon chiffon, key lime pie and kiwi accented with green apple, white nectarine and pineapple. Decisively refreshing, this wine finishes clean with lingering notes of dragon fruit, passionfruit and citrus.

description.data:
The rich yet elegant 2021 DAOU Reserve Chardonnay, blended from exemplary
lots by Winemaker Daniel Daou, offers inviting aromas of lemon chiffon, ripe pineapple, hibiscus flower
and white peach. Notes of piña colada and warm buttered toast are accented by touches of nutmeg and
clove. The mouthfeel is succulent and lively, displaying generous flavors of Crenshaw melon, pineapple,
sliced nectarine and vanilla bean. Impressions of hazelnut, Bosc pear and honey round out the mid palate,
all leading to a crisp, clean finish that lingers with essences of citrus zest and star jasmine.

description.data: Named for the father of Georges and Daniel Daou, Soul of a Lion is the crown jewel of DAOU, and an emblem of our quest to produce unsurpassed Cabernet Sauvignon from the terroir of DAOU Mountain. The 2020 vintage presents an alluring profusion of black cherry, mulberry and Oregon blackberry aromas with notes of leather, cigar box and dark chocolate. Hints of desert sage and crème de menthe accent the rich fruit. The palate is silky and voluptuous, delivering loads of currant, cassis, black raspberry and ripe cherry. Notes of fig and baking spice are underscored by earthy tones of dates and truffle. Mature, ripe tannins yield a weighty, velvety texture integrated with a limestone minerality and subtle oak. A lengthy finish leaves lingering impressions of blackberry, plum and espresso with a touch of white pepper. A wine of immense staying power that will evolve favorably for many years to come.

description.data:
Hailing from the exemplary 2020 vintage, this DAOU Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon showcases Paso Robles as a world-class region for Bordeaux-style wines. Classic aromas of Oregon blackberry, Zante currant and cherry pipe tobacco anticipate subtle notes of cranberry, baking spice, licorice, slate and dark chocolate. The palate is voluptuous and velvety with a firm underlying structure. Lavish
flavors of blueberry, black raspberry, wild cherry and cassis are beautifully integrated with hints of truffle, dried herbs and forest floor. A smooth, persistent finish lingers with impressions of of sweet cherry, black plum and mushroom. While polished and approachable now, this is a Cabernet Sauvignon that will continue to evolve with grace and nuance.

description.data: Soul of a Lion is DAOU’s crown jewel, named after the father of Georges and Daniel Daou. True to Soul of a Lion’s reputation as DAOU’s most coveted Cabernet Sauvignon, the 2018 vintage is nothing short of a tour de force. This wine displays all the hallmarks of its cooler growing season—richness, elegance and balance. A dark, purple-black hue foreshadows the experience to come. Intense aromas of lilac, violet and spice swirl amid a deep, complex bouquet. The palate bursts with prodigious flavors of blueberry, boysenberry, plum, vanilla bean and chocolate-covered cherry, all underlain by striking minerality. Silky, integrated tannins unwind into an impossibly long finish, revealing both the power and finesse of its DAOU Mountain provenance.

description.data: 2019 produced possibly the greatest vintage DAOU Mountain has ever experienced, with heavy rains during dormancy, moderate temperatures and extended hang time yielding a mighty harvest. The ample winter rainfall—close to 40 inches total—gave way to a healthy cover crop that replenished the soil’s micronutrient levels. The climate throughout the growing season was perfect, with temperatures mostly in the 80s and 90s, and not a single day reaching 100 degrees during the entire year. The harvested grapes arrived in exquisite condition, showing no damage, sunburn or shriveling. The resulting wines are marked by elegance and power, with moderate alcohols and great acidity that promise excellent longevity.

description.data: Made from gently pressed Grenache grapes in the classic Old World style, the 2022 Rosé presents a pretty pale flamingo hue with scintillating aromas of fresh strawberry, guava, crème brûlée and honeysuckle. Subtle hyacinth and ginger notes are accompanied by cranberry, rhubarb, cherry blossom and lemon meringue. The palate is exquisitely balanced, displaying a lush, crisp juiciness with flavors of ripe strawberry, papaya, nectarine and mandarin orange. Hints of spiced peach, mango and watermelon are complemented by red delicious apple, kiwi, apricot and honeydew melon, all cascading into a clean, refreshing finish.

description.data:
Inspired by the renowned rosé wines of Provence, France, our 2020 DAOU Discovery
Collection Rosé remains faithful to its origins. This wine is remarkably fragrant,
offering generous aromas of fresh peach, Bartlett pear and nectarine, with subtle notes
of hyacinth, apricot and crushed rose petals. The palate is delightfully silky, underlying
a clean, fresh crispness delivering enticing flavors of mango, Crenshaw melon, lemon

orange peel accents. A luxurious and lasting finish leaves traces of apple pie, strawberry
and kiwi.

description.data: The 2019 PATRIMONY Cabernet Sauvignon is nothing short of a blockbuster wine from a banner vintage, meticulously shepherded to greatness by Winemaker Daniel Daou. This 100-percent Cabernet Sauvignon from DAOU Mountain is the epitome of a terroir-driven wine that displays immense power without sacrificing elegance. It explodes from the glass with boysenberry, crème de cassis, cedar, cigar, crushed stone and lead pencil accompanied by a perfume of violets. Deep, full bodied and rich with astonishing texture, it manages to stay fresh and balanced throughout an unending finish. This wine will ultimately reveal its complete and extraordinary potential after several years in the bottle.

description.data: The 2020 Bodyguard is the newest edition to this exceptional collection from winemaker Daniel Daou. Bold and brooding, it displays a vivid, deep purple hue accompanied by an intense nose of chocolate-covered blueberry, black raspberry, Zante currant, pencil lead and damp forest floor. Secondary layers reveal notes of kirsch, fennel, black olive and a hint of cool wintergreen. A lush palate of black plum, dried cherry and blackberry is supported by a firm structure with polished fine-grained tannins. Highlights of dusty leather, dried sage and truffle add layers of complexity that complement the rich, dark fruit. The finish strikes an impressive balance of power and grace, with lingering notes of currant, dark chocolate and crushed stone minerality that enhance the fullness of the experience.

description.data: The classically styled 2019 DAOU Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon showcases Paso Robles as a world-class region for Bordeaux-style wines. It opens with a highly perfumed nose of black cherry, mulberry, plum and Oregon blackberry, all underlain by notes of cassis, kirsch, licorice, and crushed gravel. Secondary aromas of dark chocolate, coffee and dried sage reveal an elegant complexity. On the palate, it is powerful, balanced and brimming with layers of fruit and spice. Tempting flavors of Zante currant, boysenberry and black plum anticipate accents of cigar box, mocha, crushed herbs and pencil shavings. Firm, fine-grained tannins provide ample structure to support a lengthy finish of sweet cherry, leather, toasty oak and vanilla crème brûlée. In the end, the 2019 vintage is nothing short of an immensely approachable wine that will age with grace and refinement.

description.data: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this wine perfectly shows the marriage possible by these two grapes when blended together. One can not but be taken by the uber-dark color of this wine. Yet, when the first sip is taken, an unexpected profile emerges from the glass with elegance and freshness accompanied by a wealth of minerality. The nose explodes with aromas of cassis, cured meats, coffee, licorice, dark chocolate and spice. Full-bodied, this flawlessly balanced wine will keep you thinking for a long time while the finish does not stop. Layered and complex, it will age beautifully for decades and continue to improve.

description.data: Reminiscent of a top wine from the right bank of Bordeaux, this wine exhibits incredible concentration and depth accompanied by minerality that is expressed through crushed stones on the palate. On the nose, the wine explodes with flavors of crushed black cherry, violets, cigar box, incence and cedar notes. While powerful and rich, it remains balanced with elegance that is never compromised. The tannins are silky and velvety with an underlining structure that is present but not overpowering. The wine retains freshness and finishes very long.

description.data:
The 2021 vintage delivers yet another stunning blend with trademark
Pessimist flair. This wine is powerful and intensely aromatic out of the glass, presenting fragrances of blueberry, boysenberry and black plum. Secondary layers reveal elderberry, truffle, cocoa and cardamom spice accented by hints of eucalyptus, leather, cherry pipe tobacco and grilled meats. Broad and expansive on the palate, it bestows lush, generous flavors of black cherry, blueberry crème de cassis and damp forest floor. Hints of lavender, anise and black olive complement the rich, ripe fruit flavors. Massive in weight yet
elegantly structured, this wine is a powerhouse that reveals itself gradually yet deliberately. It finishes smoothly with leisure and length, on notes of blackberry, espresso bean and pomegranate.

description.data:
Conceived by brothers Georges and Daniel Daou, Bodyguard
Chardonnay is a wine of elegance and opulence. The 2021 vintage
displays a rich, fragrant nose with aromas of spiced pear, star jasmine, vanilla bean and tropical rain forest. Trailing scents of pineapple, mango, crushed filberts and buttered toast are accented by hints of allspice and honeysuckle. A crisp, silky palate expands with mouthwatering flavors of white peach, pineapple, honeydew melon and lemon zest. Underlying tropical notes of papaya, kiwi and passion fruit are laced with toasty oak and baking spices, and a lush, clean finish reveals lingering impressions of citrus, almond and vanilla.

description.data: The classically styled 2019 DAOU Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon showcases Paso Robles as a world-class region for Bordeaux-style wines. It opens with a highly perfumed nose of black cherry, mulberry, plum and Oregon blackberry, all underlain by notes of cassis, kirsch, licorice, and crushed gravel. Secondary aromas of dark chocolate, coffee and dried sage reveal an elegant complexity. On the palate, it is powerful, balanced and brimming with layers of fruit and spice. Tempting flavors of Zante currant, boysenberry and black plum anticipate accents of cigar box, mocha, crushed herbs and pencil shavings. Firm, fine-grained tannins provide ample structure to support a lengthy finish of sweet cherry, leather, toasty oak and vanilla crème brûlée. In the end, the 2019 vintage is nothing short of an immensely approachable wine that will age with grace and refinement.

description.data: 2019 produced possibly the greatest vintage DAOU Mountain has ever experienced, with heavy rains during dormancy, moderate temperatures and extended hang time yielding a mighty harvest. The ample winter rainfall—close to 40 inches total—gave way to a healthy cover crop that replenished the soil’s micronutrient levels. The climate throughout the growing season was perfect, with temperatures mostly in the 80s and 90s, and not a single day reaching 100 degrees during the entire year. The harvested grapes arrived in exquisite condition, showing no damage, sunburn or shriveling. The resulting wines are marked by elegance and power, with moderate alcohols and great acidity that promise excellent longevity.

description.data: Inspired by the wines of Saint-Émilion, the 2019 DAOU Reserve Seventeen Forty presents a harmonious marriage of Cabernet Franc and Merlot. The nose is rich and refined, revealing scents of ripe boysenberry, fragrant plum, sweet cherry, cocoa and pomegranate. Subtle notes of crème de cassis, black olive, pencil lead and sandalwood underpin the lush fruit aromas. Flavors of blackberry, cherry, dark chocolate and espresso dominate the palate, accented by hints of truffle, tobacco leaf and dried flowers. This wine is beautifully structured, with supple tannins that provide the backbone for a long, vibrant finish of black plum, currant, loganberry and mocha. While eminently approachable now, this 2019 vintage will reward careful cellaring for years to come.

While polished and approachable now, this is a Cabernet Sauvignon that will continue to evolve with grace and nuance.

description.data:

juicy berries, dark chocolate and sage.

brandHighlight.data: Founded in 1996 by Joel Gott, a 4th generation California vintner, Joel Gott Wines is rooted in authenticity and is committed to crafting fruit-forward, balanced, delicious wines for people to enjoy.

description.data: Joel Gott Sauvignon Blanc White Wine is made with a blend of fruit from varied growing regions across California, creating a balanced, food-friendly wine. This dry white wine showcases aromas of peach, honeydew, guava and passionfruit with crisp, refreshing acidity on the mid-palate and a long, clean, balanced finish.  The 2021 vintage Joel Gott Sauvignon Blanc was awarded 91 points from Wine Spectator in July 2022. This food-friendly dry white wine pairs well with ahi tuna burgers, pizza or fresh fruit. To preserve the wine’s fruit and natural acidity, it undergoes a long, cool fermentation in stainless steel tanks. One 375mL wine bottle of Joel Gott Sauvignon Blanc White Wine has 13.9% alchol by volume. Joel Gott Wines selects the best fruit from a variety of growing regions and blends them to create more balanced, clean, complex and elegant wines that are fun and affordable. Together, the small, dynamic team at Joel Gott Wines shares the same love and dedication for wine making. Since 1996, Joel Gott Wines have all the things that matter: structure, sweet fruit, tannins, mouthfeel, color, and they have a great time making it.

brandHighlight.data: Amador Whiskey Company, is passionate about making limited-production, luxury whiskey. Their first creation was Amador Whiskey 10-Barrel, a California straight hop-flavored whiskey crafted with a craft California IPA beer and finished in Napa Cellars Chardonnay barrels. Their second offering, Amador Whiskey Co. Double Barrel, marries the best of Kentucky whiskey with different wine barrel finishes. They hope you enjoy these exceptional whiskies as much as they enjoyed creating them.

text.data: Distilled spirits like whiskey, vodka, gin, rum and tequila: Slightly cooler than room temperature, at 55-60 degrees Fahrenheit / 13-16 degrees Celsius.

description.data: Amador Whiskey Double Barrel Wheated Chardonnay Barrel Bourbon is an elevated bourbon that blends the familiar flavors of the south with the spirit of the golden state. Crossing the plains to California, Amador Whiskey Double Barrel Wheated Chardonnay Bourbon landed in the sprawling hills of Napa Valley. This high-wheated bourbon was first aged three years in new charred American oak barrels, where it took on enticing notes of brown sugar, nuts and hints of baking spices. The liquid gold was finished in medium toast French oak Chardonnay barrels for 9 to 12 months in Napa Valley. The Chardonnay barrels infuse vanilla flavors and create a creamy mouthfeel that offers a long, satisfying finish. This copper classic delivers notes of vanilla, caramel, butterscotch and roasted almonds that seamlessly intertwine with hints of honey and tobacco for a rich and full-bodied drink, whether neat, over ice, or in a favorite whiskey cocktail. One 750mL bottle of Amador Whiskey Double Barrel Wheated Chardonnay Barrel is 86 Proof, 43% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: Our timeless American story dates back three generations to when the Trinchero family left their home in New York City to pursue the American Dream in Napa Valley. The family purchased Sutter Home Winery in 1948, after the winery had been closed for almost 30 years due to Prohibition. Still family-owned and now celebrating our 75th anniversary this year, Sutter Home has a long history of delivering wine that people love, starting with the creation of the original White Zinfandel in the 1970s. Sutter Home is proud to be the brand generations of wine lovers trust to deliver consistent, award-winning quality and value for every wine occasion. We were honored to be awarded the Distinguished Service Award for “having introduced more Americans to wine on the table than anyone in history” from Wine Spectator. We will forever stand by our promise to create “a great product for a fair price.”

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Sutter Home Cabernet Sauvignon is a California red wine with bold, powerful aromas and flavors. Full bodied with a rich aroma to delight the senses, this Cabernet wine features dark fruit flavors, including juicy red cherries and black currants, with red cherry, sweet vanilla, toasted oak and light herbal aromas. This Cabernet has a soft mouthfeel rounded out by a medium-bodied, lasting finish. This wine has been awarded over 600 Gold medals since 2004, including 90 points-Gold from 2023 Toast of the Coast Wine Competition and 91-Silver from 2022 California State Fair. Open this wine bottle and serve with grilled steak, eggplant parmesan and braised lamb shanks. Sourced from California, this dry red wine undergoes a malolactic fermentation wine making process, resulting in bold aromas and flavor. This bottled wine has 12.9% alcohol by volume. Sutter Home, family owned since 1948, is the brand generations of wine lovers trust to deliver consistent, award-winning quality and value for every wine occasion.

brandHighlight.data: Since opening its doors in 2016, Bodega Garzon is Uruguay's most celebrated winery, with ground-breaking awards and accolades for its wines and winery tourism. From the Reserva Range, up to the Single Vineyard Tier and culminating with the icon wine, Balasto, Garzon's wines introduce wine drinkers to fresh, textured and rich wines that exude the unique terroir of Uruguay's Atlantic Coast. Winery tourism highlights include Chef Mallmann designed restaurant, PGA golf, luxury wine club and LEED-certified architectureal achievements. A Top 100 Winery of 2020 from Wine & Spirits Magazine and recipient  of the New World Winery of the Year award in 2018 from Wine Enthusiast Magazine, Garzon has earned a global reputation for leadership in fine-wine, with a special focus on Tannat and Albarino. The wines are crafted by award-winning enologist Alberto Antonini with local winemaker, German Bruzzone and benefit from the maritime climate close to the Atlantic and ancient ballast, free-draining soils.

description.data: This red wine represents the signature Uruguayan varietal that has found its ideal soil in Garzón. An intense red and black fruit wine with a lingering and lush aftertaste. Elegant and powerful, this wine greets you with aromas of raspberry and red cherry followed by flavors of black plum, rhubarb and tobacco mixed with dark chocolate and white pepper. It has a finish that presents a brilliant tension between silky tannins and supple fruit. Ideal partner to grilled and juicy cuts of meat, as well as any braised or meat based pasta, such as bolognese with guanciale.

brandHighlight.data:
Built of stone in 1898, La Jota Vineyard Co. has deep roots in Napa Valley’s winemaking history. Today, Winemaker Chris Carpenter produces small quantities of mountain Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Cabernet Franc from the winery’s estate La Jota Vineyard and nearby W.S. Keyes Vineyard. The wines capture the intense fruit and mineral complexity of their cool-climate location on Howell Mountain.
  
La Jota Vineyard Co. has deep roots in Napa Valley’s winemaking history. It was W. S. Keyes who planted the first vines on Howell Mountain, back in 1888. Ten years later, and a mile down the road, fellow Howell Mountain pioneer Frederick Hess established the La Jota Vineyard—named after the property’s location on the Mexican land grant Rancho La Jota—and built a stone winery that still stands today. While growing grapes in the nutrient-lean, volcanic soils of these vineyards is a challenge, the rewards are undeniable. Highly concentrated flavors and muscular tannins slowly mature to perfection, while the cool winds, diurnal temperature swings and high altitude keep the grape acids impeccably balanced.

description.data: The intent of this Chardonnay, grown on Howell Mountain, is to reflect a sense of place. Every effort is used to minimize the effects of winemaking and highlight the W.S. Keyes Vineyard, low oak and no malolactic contribute to that. It is picked at relatively low sugar to preserve acidity and capture more stone fruit, apple/pear, and minerality characters. The W.S. Keyes Chardonnay opens with a complimentary nose of white peach and other orchard fruit, jasmine, and almond. On the palate, a mineral-drenched core of red and green apples is complicated by maple butter, white pepper, and toast. The overarching compilation of fruit, floral, savory, and spice is remarkable, conveying both energy and richness in this complex bottle. Pairs with scallops, crab and lobster, bone-in pork chop and triple crème cheese.  This bottled California chardonnay is 14% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: The W.S. Keyes Chardonnay opens with a complimentary nose of white peach and other orchard fruit, jasmine, and almond. On the palate, a mineral-drenched core of red and green apples is complicated by maple butter, white pepper, and toast. The overarching compilation of fruit, floral, savory, and spice is remarkable, conveying both energy and richness in this complex bottle.

brandHighlight.data:
Founded in 1994 by Don and Jennifer Hartford, the Hartford Family Winery resides in a French-style chateau in the town of Forestville, in the southwestern Russian River Valley. The winery specializes in small lots of vineyard-designated wines of high personality. The wines are labeled with two distinct marks: Hartford Court for the Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, and Hartford for old-vine Zinfandel from the Russian River Valley. In recent years, Hartford Family Winery has produced over 25 single-vineyard wines from discrete vineyard blocks from extraordinary vineyard sites extending from Sta. Rita Hills in California north to Eola-Amity Hills in Oregon.
  
Hartford Family Winery was founded in 1994 as a result of Don and Jennifer Hartford’s appreciation for the wines, the people, and the unique vineyards near their Russian River Valley home. Located in the Sonoma County town of Forestville, the winery is about 15 miles from the cool Pacific Coast.

Making delicious wines of high personality is directly related to the difficult locations of our vineyard sources, the limited production of our bottlings and the varietals we use. “Character through adversity” is an expression that we believe applies to people and grapevines and surviving adversity builds character, and personality, in both.

Hartford Family Winery specializes in making wines from single vineyard sites. In recent vintages we have made about 25 different single vineyard bottlings. Small and low-yielding vineyards deliver expressive and personality-rich wine. Our single vineyard Hartford Court Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays total as few as 93 cases, up to about 800 cases. Likewise, our Hartford Old Vine Zinfandels are produced in small quantities. Our single vineyard wines are highly allocated.

brandHighlight.data:
Located in the Bennett Valley sub-region of Sonoma County, Matanzas Creek Winery earned its reputation as a pioneer for Sauvignon Blanc and Merlot in the 1970s. The winery's estate vineyards in Sonoma County are sustainably farmed, extending from the cool coastline to the inland valley and producing a diversity of expressions of its celebrated Sauvignon Blanc and Merlot wines. Beyond the widespread recognition of the wines, Matanzas Creek is famous for its stunning lavender gardens.
  
With four decades of winemaking heritage, Matanzas Creek’s expertise in Sauvignon Blanc dates to the beginning, when founding winemaker Merry Edwards developed her signature style. The winery has a rich history of industry leadership, including launching the careers of many renowned California winemakers, producing pioneering research on clonal significance, and spearheading the founding of the Bennett Valley AVA. Since its start in 1977, Matanzas Creek has left an indelible mark on the California wine industry.

Today, the aromatic expertise of winemaker Marcia Torres-Forno, experience in Chile, Napa, and Sonoma, shines through in each bottle. Achieving the signature delicacy in all of Matanzas Creek’s wines requires strict attention to detail. Timing of the pick in the vineyards is determined by grape hue signaling aromas of the fruit, which are then cultivated in the cellar with careful selection of fermentation vessel types. 

Matanzas Creek wines are sourced from the optimal growing sites for each offering. The wines are always crafted to express a profound sense of place, and delicately woven into the portfolio with a common thread of simple elegance.

description.data: The Knights Valley Sauvignon Blanc white wine is sourced from the picturesque valley that separates Napa and Sonoma County. This Sauvignon Blanc is hand-harvested towards the end of August. Three different vineyard blocks are used in this white wine and while each shines independently, they truly are elevated together. Fermentation happens in a mix of neutral French oak and concrete eggs. The wines were fermented dry with no subsequent malolactic fermentation. During the months of aging, all vessels were stirred monthly to build luxurious texture in preparation for bottling. This white wine has captivating aromas of white peach, honeydew melon and Amaryllis, followed by candied melon and citrus on the palate. Round, plush and firm, with a satiny mouthfeel and long finish. Captivating aromas of white peach, honeydew melon and amaryllis on the nose are followed by candied melon and citrus on the palate.  Round, plush and firm, this age worthy Sauv Blanc pairs with your any of your favorite oysters.  This bottled California sauvignon blanc is 14.5% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This white wine has captivating aromas of white peach, honeydew melon and Amaryllis, followed by candied melon and citrus on the palate. Round, plush and firm, with a satiny mouthfeel and long finish.

description.data: Moon Mountain is a unique appellation located on the southern end of the Mayacamas Range overlooking the Sonoma Valley. The vineyards range in altitude from 400 to over 2,000 feet, characterized by ancient volcanic soils and lava flows. The district basks in the warmth of the day, with cooling breezes rolling in from the Pacific Ocean during the afternoon.

tastingNotesText.data: An intense red with purple hues in color, the aroma is layered with brown spice and ripe black fruit. This wine has immense power and finesse. The flavors are layered with dark-roasted oak, aromatic spice and ripe fruit with hints of chocolate and dark toffee.

description.data:
Conceived by brothers Georges and Daniel Daou, Bodyguard Chardonnay
is a wine of uncommon opulence. The 2020 vintage offers fragrant
aromas of golden apple, buttered toast, honey and lilac. Subtle notes of
bartlett pear, star fruit, hibiscus and nutmeg round out the elegant, floral
bouquet. The texture is smooth and silky, cascading across the palate
with enticing flavors of spiced pear, Granny Smith apple, golden kiwi
and honeysuckle, all underlain by mouthwatering minerality. Secondary
layers reveal nuances of white peach and toasty oak, hazelnut, honeydew
melon and citrus zest. A crisp, clean finish shows remarkable length with
lingering notes of lemon curd and pineapple.

brandHighlight.data: Etude was founded on the philosophy that winemaking begins in exceptional vineyards, long before the Fall harvest, where superior grape growing leads to wines with authentic varietal expression, wonderful flavors and a telling reflection of where the wines are grown.

description.data: A beautiful expression of Carneros, Napa Valley Pinot Noir, Etude Grace Benoist Ranch Carneros Pinot Noir Red Wine is packed with bright cherry and berry flavors with the added complexity of spice and earth notes. Youthful and fresh, with the potential to age for up to a decade, enjoy this red wine with roasted pork or smoky glazed ham. Etude was founded on the philosophy that winemaking begins in exceptional vineyards, long before the fall harvest, where superior grape growing leads to wines with authentic varietal expression, wonderful flavors, and a telling reflection of where the wines are grown. The farming of our owned Santa Barbara Vineyards is uniquely hands-on, which ensures viticulture practices and farming measures are comparable with that of Etude’s Estate Vineyards.

tastingNotesText.data: A vibrant ruby red, garnet color, with aromas of lifted red berries, black cherry and fresh strawberry, alongside earth and spice notes of cedar, pink peppercorn and crushed tea leaf, finishing with brown baking spice notes of nutmeg, cinnamon and clove, characteristics often found in Grace Benoist Ranch Pinot Noirs. Rich, round and silky with bright acidity and long, fine-grained tannins that suggest the opportunity to age a bit, for further development of the complex layers of flavor.

brandHighlight.data:
Cà Romé is a true family winery, nestled in the heart of Barbaresco. It was founded by Romano Marengo in 1980 after a 30-year career in the wine industry, during which he dreamed of making his own terroir-driver wines. Today it is run by Romano’s children, Winemaker Giuseppe Marengo and Director of Operations, Paola Marengo.
 
The Cà Romé philosophy is reflected in the name: Cà is short for casa, which means “home” and refers to Romano’s home and a winery that is run by a family, not a corporation.

description.data:
‘Rapet’ means small grape in dialect. In 1986, this vineyard was hit by a hailstorm, resulting in bunches with small grapes. A typical expression of Serralunga d’Alba.
This is a single-vineyard parcel planted in 1972 in the Serralunga cru under MGA Cerretta, renowned for its structure.

tastingNotesText.data: Intense garnet red with ruby reflections. Fruity aromas with floral and spicy notes. Intense flavor with opulent and enveloping tannins and a long finish.

text.data: True family-run operation, founded in 1980 by father, Romano Marengo and now shared with his children Giuseppe (Pino), Paola and Maria, as well as his wife Olimpia
Giuseppe continues his father’s efforts, carefully managing every phase of production and winemaking
Paola manages the Sales and Operations side with tireless energy and a smile that emits full optimism and passion
Family’s values are transmitted through their passion for this project – quality, honesty, respect for tradition, and exploration

brandHighlight.data: Dating to the 17th century, the Marcello de Majno estate is in the Prosecco Treviso DOC adjacent to the esteemed Conegliano area. Abundant light, Adriatic winds and the Venetian pre-Alps provide the terroir to fully express the Glera grape. All the wines are sourced from estate grapes, which means that quality is ensured from grape to glass. Giovanni Mazzei initiated a renaissance at his maternal grandmother's estate in Veneto with Villa Marcello.

description.data: Villa Marcello’s Brut Rosé is a vintage-dated, low dosage, estate-grown prosecco rosé with delicate strawberries and cream character.

tastingNotesText.data: Notes of white peach, floral with hints of raspberry and wild strawberry. Elegant, sapid, full bodied with a long lasting finish.

brandHighlight.data: MARTINI & ROSSI® captures the spark that set two men on a lifelong quest to make their stamp on Italian culture. Alessandro Martini - a spirited entrepreneur with a global vision - and Luigi Rossi - a creative muse whose botanical fragrances would lure noses along Turin’s Via Dora Grossa... The year was 1863 when their newfound partnership was manifested in their first vermouth: The MARTINI & ROSSI® Rosso. This original blend remains the same to this day.

description.data: Martini & Rossi Extra Dry Vermouth made its debut on New Year’s Day in 1900 after ten years of being perfected. This exceptional vermouth went on to become an iconic Martini & Rossi drink that dominated the century, the Dry Martini & Rossi cocktail. The Martini & Rossi and Tonic is always a welcome call at parties, receptions and social occasions.

tastingNotesText.data: Martini & Rossi® Extra Dry Vermouth captures the essence of dry vermouth through Florentine orris root. Wrestled from the ground after three long years of growth, then sun-dried and pressed, the root releases its unique violet-scented and tart aromatic oils, lending a recognizable taste to Martini & Rossi® Extra Dry Vermouth. With its sharp citrus aromas and hint of raspberry, this is a classic of its kind and adds a playful flavor to a Martini cocktail.

text.data: WARNING: Drinking distilled spirits, beer, coolers, wine and other alcoholic beverages may increase cancer risk, and, during pregnancy, can cause birth defects. For more information go to www.P65Warnings.ca.gov/alcohol.

MARTINI & ROSSI Extra Dry Vermouth, cocktail mixer
White vermouth that captures the essence of rare woods, herbs and citrus
Dry white vermouth with tart, violet-scented notes and a bright finish
Pair cocktail drink mixer with silver shimmering sardines
Best served alone or in mixed drinks like a MARTINI & ROSSI and tonic

brandHighlight.data: Live life in the sunshine with Del Mar Agave Wine Margarita. Crafted in Mexican tradition, Del Mar is made with Organic Blue Weber Agave Wine sourced from Jalisco, Mexico, real fruit juice, and all-natural flavors, resulting in a classically delicious Margarita. Del Mar, meaning “of the sea”, knows life by the ocean. All it takes is one sip to take you to a beach state of mind!

description.data: Refreshing and tangy, Del Mar Pacifica Lime Margarita opens with zesty notes of real lime juice accompanied by fresh flavors of Organic Blue Weber Agave from Jalisco, Mexico making them naturally gluten free, vegan friendly and delicious to drink. With a juicy mouthfeel and crisp finish, you’ll be reaching for the beach and another Del Mar Margarita! This wine pack comes with four 187mL bottles of Del Mar Pacifica Lime Margarita Wine Cocktail and contains 13.9% alcohol by volume. Del Mar 187mLs are shatterproof, recyclable and have a screw cap for added convenience. No corkscrew required. Simply twist the top, pour over ice and enjoy!

brandHighlight.data: Napa Cellars has been making wine for more than 40 years. Their winery sits on the original five acres that established Napa Cellars winery in 1976 along historic Highway 29 in Oakville. They still welcome guests to their tasting room in the geodesic dome commissioned by founder Charlie Woods. They tip their hats to the prominent Napa families, from the Franks to the Rombauers, who graced their cellar during its storied early days. Today, they carve their own path, building on that rich heritage to craft wines that are a classic, unmistakable interpretation of Napa Valley.

description.data: Napa Cellars Chardonnay White Wine offers a classically styled Chardonnay made from hand-picked grapes sourced from the Napa Valley. Aromas of fresh Fuji apple, lemon curd, guava, white peach and creme fraiche highlight this well-balanced, full-bodied classically styled Chardonnay. A soft mouthfeel supports flavors of guava, pineapple, Braeburn apple, cloves, coconut and Bosc pear leading to lemony, balanced acidity and a long, creamy finish of mild toasted oak and creme brulee. The 2018 vintage received 90 points from Decanter and 90 points from Wine Enthusiast, and the 2019 vintage received 93 points from the Tasting Panel in 2021. Open a wine bottle of this dry Chardonnay wine to pair with chicken saffron brochettes, a Camembert French cheese plate drizzled with local honey and almond halves or panna cotta topped with fresh berries. The white wine Chardonnay grapes were selected from vineyards in renowned Chardonnay locations including south Napa Valley, Oak Knoll and Carneros. Proximity of these vineyards to the fog and breeze from San Francisco and Marin Bay creates a cooler climate, which is ideal for growing Chardonnay. At Napa Cellars, the Chardonnay grapes are carefully hand-picked, harvested and crushed. This Napa Valley Chardonnay dry white wine is fermented and aged in French oak barrels, 26% of which were new, and undergoes 97% malolactic fermentation and lees stirring for five months. It has 14% alcohol by volume. With more than 40 years of winemaking heritage in California’s most fabled wine region, Napa Cellars embodies the classic, unmistakable style of Napa Valley. Veteran winemaker Joe Shirley crafts our wines from estate vineyards and coveted partner sites throughout Napa’s most revered sub-appellations. Meticulous care in the vineyard, coupled with gentle winemaking techniques, ensures our wines reflect the quality and richness of Napa Valley’s terroir.

brandHighlight.data: Grown in sustainable vineyards in Monterey County, coastal influences create bright, balanced, and food-friendly wines. Complicated wines are designed to look and taste great, and show you how uncomplicated well-crafted wine can be. It’s a little tongue-in-cheek, but it’s exactly how they feel: open it, pour it, sip it, enjoy it.

description.data: Complicated Chardonnay wine is sourced from Monterey County and is an approachable white wine that intrigues with old world elegance. Flavors offer bright, crisp green apple dipped in white chocolate, sweet white peach, lime juice and a hint of vanilla and subtle oak. Beautiful golden straw in color, this Chardonnay is a white wine that has inviting aromas of pear, melon, floral notes, brioche bread and crème brulee, framed by lemon and baking spices. The palate of this wine has a creamy texture and round smooth lingering finish. A smooth, mellow, medium finish makes this a great, food friendly Chardonnay wine that pairs well with cheese, fruit and nut-based charcuterie board, simple pastas with butter, pepper and lemon or a light, flaky white fish. Once fermentation was complete, the highest quality lots were blended and aged to ensure the best aromatic and structural components worked in harmony. Complicated Wines are designed to look and taste great, and show you how uncomplicated well-crafted wine can be. This bottle of wine has 13.9% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: Our timeless American story dates back three generations to when the Trinchero family left their home in New York City to pursue the American Dream in Napa Valley. The family purchased Sutter Home Winery in 1948, after the winery had been closed for almost 30 years due to Prohibition. Still family-owned, Sutter Home has a long history of delivering wine that people love, starting with the creation of the original White Zinfandel in the 1970s. Sutter Home is proud to be the brand generations of wine lovers trust to deliver consistent, award-winning quality and value for every wine occasion. We were honored to be awarded the Distinguished Service Award for “having introduced more Americans to wine on the table than anyone in history” from Wine Spectator. We will forever stand by our promise to create “a great product for a fair price.”

description.data: Sutter Home Sweet Riesling White Wine offers a California interpretation of a classic German wine. An alluring floral fragrance opens to rich flavors of ripe apricots, juicy summer peaches and tropical fruit accented by hints of spice on the palate. It offers a luxurious, satiny mouthfeel balanced by crisp, refreshing acidity and a touch of sweetness in a balanced dry wine. Awards for this California wine include Best Riesling - Gold from the 2018 Toast of the Coast and 94 Points - Best of Class from the 2019 New World International. This dry white wine pairs well with mild and creamy cheeses, traditional roast turkey and fresh raspberry or apple tart. The wine making process includes gently pressing grapes in tank presses and cold fermenting the semi sweet wine in refrigerated steel tanks. This wine has 12.4% alcohol by volume.

Light bodied, bright, and fresh, this balanced, fruit-forward red wine features juicy berry and citrus flavors, including hints of orange, lemon, and lime, with a subtle hint of warm spice notes leading to a crisp, refreshing finish. This wine is the winner of Gold in the 2018 Monterey Wine Competition and received 90 Points - Gold in the 2019 Toast of the Coast. Serve this fun and festive sweet wine over ice with fresh fruit garnishes. It pairs well with ahi tuna tacos, chicken wings and pork tenderloin. Grapes used in the wine making process come from premier California vineyards from locations including the Sierra Foothills, Lodi, and the Central Coast. This wine has 12% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data:
Founded in Sonoma County in 1985 in a spirit of love and friendship by Tim Murphy, Dale Goode and Dave Ready Sr., Sonoma County’s own Murphy-Goode Winery crafts some of California’s best wines without taking itself too seriously. The story lives on today under the Jackson Family Wines portfolio, continuing a tradition based on a shared appreciation of friendship, hard work, a wicked sense of humor and, of course, a good bottle of wine. Murphy-Goode offers high quality wines from some of California’s great growing regions with the approachable and inviting attitude of Sonoma County. Murphy-Goode is never pretentious, is often irreverent and is about having fun. Because of its consistent quality, the brand has become a favorite wine for consumers everywhere.
  
Murphy-Goode makes friendship their mantra because they were founded on it.
Back in 1985, good friends, Tim Murphy, Dale Goode, and Dave Ready, were deep in their weekly game of liar’s dice when an idea was formulated. On that particularly lively night, the trio decided to make their love of wine official. They pooled their collective talents together and established Murphy-Goode, a serious winery built around a common concept: don’t take life so seriously. 
The three friends began their winemaking adventure by creating Fumé Blanc and Chardonnay from the Murphy Ranch and Murphy-Goode Vineyard in Sonoma County. 
Both Tim Murphy and Dale Goode were the growers of the team. They helped to pioneer Alexander Valley by bringing wire trellising, broad scale drip irrigation, and leaf pulling to the area. Tim Murphy is also considered the father of Sonoma Sauvignon Blanc. Dave Ready was the marketer of the trio – bringing a fun personality to the winery, which it is still known for today.

description.data: The Murphy-Goode California Red Wine is a bold and balanced red wine with ripe fruit flavors and silky tannins. A blend of eight red wine varietals aged in oak barrels, this full-bodied red wine is rich and complex with a long finish that continually invites the next sip. Sourced from select vineyards, Murphy-Goode Red Wine is a luscious red wine blend that showcases the full range of flavors California red wines offer. This bottle features a convenient screw cap for fresh wine and easy pouring. This bottled California red blend is 13.5% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: A red wine comprised of different varietals to create complexity and to show off our California grapes. Aromas of dark fruit and red fruit on the palate. The mouthfeel is rich, soft and a long finish.

brandHighlight.data:
The Hickinbotham Vineyard sits in an oasis-like setting at the northern end of McLaren Vale in South Australia, in a revered corner of Clarendon wine country. First planted in 1971 by Alan David Hickinbotham, fruit was historically sold from the vineyard for icon wines from Penfolds and Hardys, before being bottled under its own label for the first time in 2012. Applying decades of experience with Napa Valley’s mountain vineyards, winemaker Chris Carpenter uses the confluence of hills, ocean, and the site’s ancient 75-million-year-old geology to create wines with enduring freshness, intensity and elegance.
  
While part of the McLaren Vale Geographical Indication, Clarendon is a distinct subregion located in the very north, on the edge of the Adelaide foothills. Its elevation affords it cooler temperatures than in most of McLaren Vale, providing it with unique diurnal weather patterns that mirror those of the great winegrowing regions of the world.

Hickinbotham Clarendon Vineyard was established by Alan Hickinbotham in 1971 when he planted dry-farmed Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz in contoured rows on the sloping site. The 200-acre vineyard has since become part of Australia’s winemaking heritage, supplying fruit to produce many of the country’s greatest wines, including Penfolds Grange Hermitage and Hardys Eileen Hardy. Breathing new life into this historic vineyard, Winemaker Christopher Carpenter has begun a new era of Hickinbotham’s prestigious legacy.

description.data: The Hickinbotham Trueman is a modern Cabernet Sauvignon that encapsulates all the toil and antiquity of Clarendon. The ability to consistently retain expressive and fragrant aromas and obtain deep tannin ripeness with concentrated fresh flavors makes Trueman one of the estate’s most highly regarded wines. The Trueman Cabernet Sauvignon possesses aromas of mulberry, Asian spices, tapenade, espresso beans and rose petals. The flavours evolve on the palate, with notes of bittersweet chocolate framed by vibrant acidity that gives way to a luxurious mid-palate and persistent finish. Pair with braised beef and beef short ribs and steak.  This bottled Australia cabernet sauvignon is 14.5% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: The Trueman Cabernet Sauvignon possesses aromas of mulberry, Asian spices, tapenade, espresso beans and rose petals. The flavours evolve on the palate, with notes of bittersweet chocolate framed by vibrant acidity that gives way to a luxurious mid-palate and persistent finish.

description.data: The Murphy-Goode California Rosé wine is fruity and vibrant with hints of refreshing minerality. Stainless steel tank fermentation allows the bright fruit character to shine through in this light-bodied rosé wine while the acidity keeps it tasting as fresh as the day it was pressed.  Sourced from select California vineyards, Murphy-Goode California Rosé wine is a great addition to any occasion inspired by the sunshine. This bottle features a convenient screw cap for fresh wine and easy pouring. This bottled California rosé is 13.5% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: Stainless steel fermentation allows the bright flavors of strawberries, grapefruit and apricot to shine through while the acidity keeps this rose wine tasting as fresh as the day it was pressed.

brandHighlight.data:
Benvolio displays true regional flavor and distinctive personality. Meaning "well-wisher" in Italian, Benvolio wines reflect their unique terroir and possess outstanding food-pairing abilities. Sourced from vineyards west of San Daniele del Friuli, along the cool hillsides of the Alps and the Austrian border, the wines have lively acidity and benefit from the cool temperatures of the region.
  
Our belief is that there is no place on Earth that cherishes the inseparable relationship between food and wine like Italy. So, it was only natural to challenge our local winemakers with the task of sourcing wines that reflect their unique, authentic terroir while possessing outstanding food-pairing ability. Benvolio is made from grapes grown by our farmers, friends and neighbors in Friuli, wines that display true regional flavor and have distinctive personality. Benvolio means “well-wisher” in Italian. As such, it is our wish that you enjoy the unmistakable flavors of our winemakers have selected for you.
Benvolio wines are from the Friuli region in the northeastern corner of Italy, an area known worldwide for its white wines. The soil is predominantly gravel and sand, which stresses the vines and allows for superior drainage. The vineyards benefit from a complex combination of microclimates, with warm air coming from the Adriatic Sea during the days, and cool night breezes drifting down from the snow-covered Alps. These are ideal conditions for grapes to mature slowly to perfect ripeness, providing full flavors and rich texture while retaining balanced acidity.

description.data: Benvolio Prosecco is an excellent expression of both the variety and the Friuli terroir. The Friuli region is in the northeastern corner of Italy, an area known worldwide for its white wines. Italy’s Friuli region is known for producing exceptional white wines crafted with balanced acidity, sugars and fresh ripe, structured fruit. This prosecco is vibrant, crisp, and refreshing. Benvolio Prosecco sparkling wine is a true expression of Italian prosecco wine and the renowned Friuli region’s terroir – the vibrant, crisp acidity acts as a counterpoint to the flavors of ripe citrus, fresh peaches, lemon, green apples, and grapefruit. The finish is light, refreshing, and crisp. Pair with fish, shellfish, chicken and white meat dishes. This bottle features a convenient screw cap for fresh wine and easy pouring. This bottled Italy prosecco is 11% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: Benvolio Prosecco sparkling wine is a true expression of Italian prosecco wine and the renowned Friuli region’s terroir – the vibrant, crisp acidity acts as a counterpoint to the flavors of ripe citrus, fresh peaches, lemon, green apples, and grapefruit. The finish is light, refreshing, and crisp.

description.data:
The 2021 DAOU Discovery Cabernet Sauvignon presents a deep ruby-purple color, foreshadowing intense aromas of cherry and blackberry jam complemented by dark chocolate, tobacco leaf and desert sage. The nose also reveals secondary nuances of wet gravel, sandalwood and plum pudding with subtle notes of fennel, black olive and eucalyptus. On the palate, a swirl of black raspberry, pomegranate,
cherry preserve and Zante currant melds seamlessly with crushed herbs, fig and cranberry. An impeccably balanced finish flows effortlessly from the juicy mid palate, leaving lovely notes of boysenberry, rhubarb, graphite and dried thyme.

brandHighlight.data:
Founded in 2014, The Angels & Cowboys journey began with a sentimental namesake, a bold icon and an appreciation for down to earth wines. 

These elements drove the vision to create an offering of wines that indulge the lover, the trailblazer and the rule breaker in all of us. These elements drove the vision to create an offering of wines that indulge the lover, the trailblazer and the rule breaker in all of us. 

Multi-varietal blends are a hallmark of Angels & Cowboys. The wines are handcrafted blends sourced from some of Sonoma County's most prestigious growers in Carneros, Russian River Valley, and Dry Creek Valley.

description.data: The Angels & Cowboys journey began with a sentimental namesake, a bold icon and an appreciation for down to earth wines. These elements drove the vision to create an offering of wines that indulge the love, the trailblazer and the rule breaker in all of us. Angels & Cowboys wines are crafted from some of Sonoma county’s most prestigious growers in Carneros, Russian River Valley and Dry Creek Valley. Our Angels & Cowboys Rosé is Grenache-based and crafted using the traditional Provençal method to preserve a delicate pink color and vibrancy on the palate.

flavorStatement.data: Our Rose opens with a nose of mandarin orange, white blossoms, and lychee fruit. On the palate it enters with zesty acidity and freshness displaying Rainier Cherry, strawberry, and guava accented by more savory notes of herbs de Provence and an attractive and cooling sea spray finish, reminiscent of the fog that blankets Sonoma County's vineyards. A lively and crowd-pleasing easy sipper, this wine will show at its best when youthful and chilled.
